Analysiert Marktdatensätze von Markt-/POS-Daten von externen Anbietern (Sell-In/Sell-Out/Verordnungsdaten) und interpretiert die Ergebnisse
Wirkt mit bei der Erstellung von Incentivierungsplänen, und ist verantwortlich für die Bewertung der Ergebnisse des Verkaufsteams auf der Grundlage der Kriterien und Ziele der Prämienregelung
Unterstützt die Geschäftseinheit bei Segmentierungs- und Targeting-Projekten
Erstellt Reportings und Sonderanalysen für Marketing und Vertrieb
Interne Datenbankpflege
Fachliche Koordination Vertriebsinformations- bzw. Reportingssysteme (BI/CRM)
Budgetverwaltung

Anforderungen

Hochschulabschluss in Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Data Science oder vergleichbar
3-5 Jahre Erfahrung als Daten- oder Marktanalyst
Erste Pharmaerfahrung von Vorteil
Sicherer Umgang mit Excel und SQL
Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten auf Deutsch und Englisch
Proaktivität und die Fähigkeit, Anforderungen aus dem Unternehmen zu verstehen

Was wir bieten
Sie werden für ein Unternehmen arbeiten, das sich für Vielfalt und Integration einsetzt und davon überzeugt ist, dass wir bessere Ergebnisse erzielen, wenn wir die Perspektiven unseres vielfältigen Kundenstamms widerspiegeln.

Galderma Laboratories GmbH bietet eine offene, von gegenseitigem Respekt geprägte Kultur. Unsere neuen Mitarbeiter können sich unter anderem freuen auf:

Eine marktkonforme Vergütung inkl. attraktivem Bonusmodell

wöchentlich frisches Obst, Wasser, Tee und Kaffee zur freien Verfügung im Innendienst
Lunchvouchers für den Innendienst, einsetzbar in vielen Geschäften in der Umgebung
Möglichkeit an internationalen Projekten mitzuwirken
Mitarbeiter Recognition Programm

Our people make a difference

At Galderma, you'll work with people who are like you. And people that are different. We value what every member of our team brings. Professionalism, collaboration, and a friendly, supportive ethos is the perfect environment for people to thrive and excel in what they do.

We provide efficient, fast and flexible solutions for our clients in field of Project Management, Recruitment as well as IT and Business functions’ Outsourcing.

Job Description

Our partner's Reporting Centre in Budapest is a key part of Finance functions of the company. There, professionals work together in a central location, to ensure consistent quality of local regulatory reporting on a global scale.

What will you do?

Create and formulate various reports that detail important aspects of the bank’s financials for the Central Banks and other regulators
Apply and develop controls and reports including reconciliations, static data and variance analysis
Be a valuable source of information to Local Finance teams, Financial Control, Treasury, Risk Departments (e.g. audits, regulatory inquiries)
Identify control improvement opportunities
Take part in process migration, efficiency and innovation projects
Exploit a collaborative and motivating attitude to join forces with colleagues for excellent results
Benefit from your organized personality, attention to details and independent working style

Qualifications

Your ideal background:

Work experience in Reporting/Accounting or related fields of Finance
University/College degree (preferably in the field of Finance)
Fluent English
Advanced MS Excel knowledge
Strong analytical skills

We do not pursue perfectionism: we look for capable colleagues and we help them frow to excellence in their fields and positions.

Additional Information

What can our partner offer?

Work in a challenging area of the financial industry
Opportunity for participation in managerial development initiatives
Cooperation with a high quality, international, multicultural and global team
Work in a friendly and diversified environment
Growth and career opportunity within the company
Management supporting balanced and agile work (home office)

description:
About Us

Global Tech Markets’ mission is to help organizations grow, evolve, and thrive. By integrating modern technology with the best people, we drive businesses forward in sustainable and smart ways. We do this by offering a range of specialist services, from which our partners can pick and choose depending on their needs.

Our range of expert services have been crafted to help businesses modernize and thrive at any point in their journey. Whether they’re just starting out and need a hand, or have a huge project in the pipeline, we’re here to guide them and do the heavy lifting where needed. Our range of services includes support, sales, VIP, CRM, Payments, Payouts, Anti-fraud, Risk Management, and more.

Our values center on providing our assistance in a friendly and human fashion, cutting out the corporate tape to deliver a practical and holistic service. We build trust, and value long-term partnerships that allow our customers, and our team to grow together.

As a member of the Payments Department, you will be responsible for creating periodic analysis and valuable insight into the performance of our Payment Providers. You will need to work collaboratively with the Payment Relationship Managers and Head of Payments to deliver analysis of partner performance, costs and KPI’s. Having a keen eye for detail and the ability to understand complex processing models is crucial for success in this role.

Your Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: responsible for analyzing, and interpreting, payment data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in payment behavior. This will involve working with data sets, running analyses, and creating visualizations to present findings.
Reporting: preparing and presenting reports on payment data to the relevant stakeholders in the organization. This will include summarizing findings, providing insights, and making recommendations for improving payment processes.
Process Improvement: work closely with the Payments Team to identify areas for process improvement. This will involve analyzing current processes, identifying inefficiencies, and recommending changes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of payment processing.
User Flow Analysis: analyze the user flow of the payment process to identify weak points and areas for improvement. This will involve examining the user journey, from a payment process perspective from start to finish and identifying any issues related to payment providers, product issues, or traffic issues.

Your Profile:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Computer Science
Proficiency in using SQL and PowerBI
Experience with data analysis and working with payment data is required.
Understand card transaction and alternative payment methods end-to-end both from a business and data perspective.
Excellent Microsoft Office skills, especially with Excel and PowerPoint.
A minimum of 1 year working in the payments industry will be considered as an advantage.

Our reward to you is:
· Competitive salary package
· Transport allowance
· Food vouchers
· Birthday vouchers, newborn vouchers
· Health Insurance
· Happy hours filled with free drinks and snacks
· Multisport cards
· Friendly work environment with positive teammates
· Team-building activities
· Great office locations

Get on board, join the fun, send us your CV already! In English.

All applications will of course be treated in the strictest confidentiality. Only the short-listed candidates will be contacted!

description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

Je bent onderdeel van het team Informatievoorziening en Automatisering (I&A) van de afdeling Financiën & Bedrijfsvoering. Dit team bestaat uit 6 collega’s waarvan er 2 werkzaam zijn als BI Specialist. Binnen dit team werk je samen aan projecten. Daarnaast heb je ook ieder je eigen verantwoordelijkheden.

Functieomschrijving

Als business intelligence specialist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het organisatie brede informatiebeheer en de informatievoorziening. Je bent gericht op het beheer en de kwaliteitsbewaking van het datamodel, het verzamelen van gegevens en het omzetten ervan in informatie. Je hebt een controlerende taak als het gaat om de kwaliteit van de gegevens.

De organisatie oriënteert zich op de implementatie van een nieuw ERP systeem. Het gebruik van verschillende data moet hiervoor opnieuw worden ingericht en dashboards moeten opnieuw worden gebouwd (Power BI). Jouw expertise is hierbij zeer welkom. Jij denkt mee over de te gebruiken data. Wat kunnen we nog meer met onze data doen? Welke behoefte is er? Welke data hebben we precies nodig en hoe zorgen we ervoor dat deze bruikbaar is? Het doel: de data op een goede manier gebruiken en daarmee stappen zetten naar een nog meer data gedreven organisatie.

Jouw Taken

Je draagt zorg voor de actualiteit van de documentatie voor het datamodel, gegevensdefinities, gegevensbeheer en rapportages en ontwikkelt documentatie, procedures en werkvoorschriften in lijn met de BISL methodiek
Je zorgt voor het implementeren van BI-projecten, onder andere op het gebied van ETL, DWH en data integratie
Je volgt wet- en regelgeving die betrekking hebben op de data
Je vertaalt wensen uit de organisatie naar geschikte BI oplossingen
Je zorgt voor het verder ontwikkelen, inrichten en onderhouden van de ETL-procedures en DWH-omgevingen
Je onderhoudt de ontwikkelde BI-producten
Je stelt procedures op voor het opschonen en verbeteren van data en focust hierbij op architectuur en datamodellen in bronsystemen en het datawarehouse
Je bouwt standaardrapportages en genereert managementinformatie
Je stelt het controleprotocol op en beheert deze
Je ondersteunt bij de aanschaf en/of vervaardiging van gebruikersdocumentatie en zorgt voor het actueel houden van de documentatie voor het datamodel, gegevensdefinities, gegevensbeheer en rapportages
Functie-eisen

HBO(+) werk- en denkniveau
inzicht in en ervaring met het verbeteren van I&A.
ervaring met het geven van uitwerking en implementatie van optimalisaties op het gebied van informatie- en datamanagement;
kennis van en ervaring met ETL, DWH en data integratie;
kennis van en ervaring met Microsoft SQL, SSIS, Visual studio en Power BI;
Ervaring met Dynamics Empire (pre)
Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Een structurele functie, voor 36 uur per week.
Jouw salaris ligt tussen €3.755 en €5.361 bruto per maand.
Je ontvangt een 13e maand
Je werkt minimaal 2 keer per week op kantoor
Je start met een jaarcontract
Gaan jullie nat dit jaar samen verder, dan ontvang je een contract voor onbepaalde tijd.
Je treedt direct in dienst bij de organisatie

description:
X

Nous recherchons au sein du référentiel produit legacy ARF, pour une mission longue durée, un nouveau collaborateur possédant un bagage technique solide pour renforcer notre équipe constituée de 8 personnes (1 proxy product owner, 1 expert technique, 1 expert fonctionnel, 5 data ingénieur).

Ses objectifs principaux seront de :
- maintenir en condition opérationnel le référentiel (implémenté sur une base de données Oracle).
- faire évoluer le référentiel en fonction des nouveaux besoins et projets de l'entreprise.
- challenger les performances du code écrit en PL/SQL ainsi que la gestion de la volumétrie de données.
- traiter l'obsolescence technique du périmètre (ex: migrer des flux ODI vers une solution cible)
- consolider/constituer la base de documents techniques autour des solutions présentes sur le périmètre.

Nous sommes une équipe Agile organisée autour de la méthodologie SCRUM.
La participation aux rituels d'équipe et l'esprit d'amélioration continu sont indispensables.
Un bon sens du relationnel est également important car le référentiel de données est central dans le SI et nous sommes amenés à travailler avec différentes équipes et interlocuteurs (métier ou IT)
2j de télétravail par semaine.

Si la data n'a plus de secret pour toi et que tu souhaites découvrir le monde du RETAIL au sein d'une équipe sympa, bienveillante et dynamique, cette mission n'attend que toi !

Oracle SQL - Expert - Impératif
Oracle PL/SQL - Expert - Impératif
Shell - Confirmé - Impératif
ODI - Confirmé - Important

description:
Fashion und Lifestyle, 6.500 Mitarbeiter:innen, 13 Department Stores, Online-Shops in Deutschland, Polen, Österreich, Belgien, Luxemburg, Spanien, den Niederlanden und der Schweiz, über 2000 Marken, 25 Restaurants & Confiserien, 15 erstklassige Services, drei Friseur-Salons und stets ein besonderes Einkaufserlebnis – das ist Breuninger. Ein Traditionsunternehmen, das internationale Wege geht, seine Ziele klar definiert und innovative Möglichkeiten schafft.

Deine Aufgaben

Breuninger wächst und wächst und trotzdem finden wir regelmäßig Sachen, die wir noch besser machen können. Damit wir unsere Kund:innen zukünftig ein noch besseres Einkaufserlebnis bieten können, brauchen wir deine Hilfe! Qualität geht bei uns dabei vor Ortsgebundenheit. Aus diesem Grund ist das Team über ganz Deutschland verstreut und arbeitet zu fast 100% remote, auch wenn die Breuni Homebase grundsätzlich in Stuttgart ist und dort jederzeit ein Schreibtisch für dich frei wäre.

In deiner Rolle als (Junior-) Digital Analyst:in Conversion Rate Optimization tauchst du ab in die Seele unserer Besucher:innen und verstehst ihre innersten Wünsche und Bedürfnisse
Du analysierst und verknüpfst relevante Daten entlang der Onsite Customer Journey, identifizierst Optimierungspotenziale und leitest daraus Handlungsempfehlungen ab – meist direkt auf unseren Tracking-Rohdaten von Webshop und App
Du vertrittst in der Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Stakeholdern die Stimme unserer Kund:innen und treibst die Transformation zum datengetriebenen Arbeiten im Unternehmen
Du bist analytischer Sparringspartner der Produktteams und Business Owner und führst gemeinsam mit ihnen Experimente zur Verbesserung unserer Shops durch (A/B-Tests). Dabei bist du verantwortlich für den Testingprozess, die Hypothesenbildung und die Testauswertung
Du führst explorative Datenanalysen durch & überwachst die Shop Leistung, um Trends und Chancen für Produktverbesserungen basierend auf Kundenverhalten zu identifizieren

Dein Profil

Du verfügst über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt oder hast dein logisches Denken anderweitig geschult. Statistikkenntnisse, logisches Denken und eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise ergänzen dein Profil optimal.
Du bringst 1-2 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Digital Analytics, Webanalytics, Business Intelligence oder vergleichbar, idealerweise im E-Commerce Umfeld mit
Du interessierst dich für Kundenpsychologie und hast Lust darauf zu verstehen, warum manche Kund:innen kaufen und andere nicht. Dabei ist eine Aufgabe für dich nicht dann erledigt, wenn die explizit gestellten Fragen deiner Stakeholder beantwortet sind, sondern wenn du ihnen die optimale Entscheidungsgrundlage zur Verfügung gestellt hast (Ownership)
Du hast gute Kenntnisse in SQL, optimalerweise hast du erste Erfahrungen in Google Big Query
Du bist in der Lage, komplexe Zusammenhänge durch gute Kommunikation einfach greifbar zu machen, indem du nicht einfach Zahlen präsentierst, sondern Geschichten erzählst (Data Storytelling).
Du bekommst leuchtende Augen, wenn du erfährst, dass unsere Analyst:innen mehr Daten zur Verfügung haben als sie jemals analysieren können und schmeißt nicht die Flinte ins Korn, nachdem du erkennst, dass sie nicht gelogen haben. Die Aussicht darauf mit einem Company-internen Tracking zu arbeiten, regt deine Fantasie an

Wir bieten

Bei uns erhältst Du die Möglichkeit, in einem modernen, agilen sowie wertschätzenden Umfeld zu arbeiten. Fühlst Du Dich angesprochen? Dann findest Du bei Breuninger ein Team, in dem Du Dich wohlfühlen und nachhaltig wirken kannst.

Attraktives Gehaltspaket mit betrieblicher Altersvorsorge und freiwilligen Sozialleistungen wie Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld
30% Mitarbeiter:innenrabatt auf alle Produkte und Leistungen inkl. Gastronomie, Friseure etc.
Persönliche und fachliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten bis hin zum Führungskräfteentwicklungsprogramm
Maximale Flexibilität bei Urlaubstagen in Form von zusätzlichen, bezahlten Urlaubstagen durch Gehaltsumwandlung
Workation und somit Möglichkeit zur Remote-Arbeit aus dem europäischen Ausland – volle Flexibilität durch Remote-Work & Workation
Corporate Benefits und attraktive Rabatte von bis zu 21.000 Unternehmen
Jobrad mittels Entgeltumwandlung günstig und unproblematisch leasen

Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann sollten wir uns schnell kennenlernen!

Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Online Bewerbung mit Angabe Deiner Verfügbarkeit sowie Gehaltsvorstellung.

description:
Inventio is a fully integrated management services company that creates unique value for corporate entities and real estate assets. Inventio offers Sales & Acquisition Advisory Services, Asset Lifecycle Management, Ad hoc/OnDemand Solutions and Added Value Services to institutional investors, investment funds and private investors.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Financial Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for financial reporting, asset management, investment analysis, and ad hoc asset management tasks.
Ideally, we are looking for candidates with 1-3 years of experience and a background in a Big 4 accounting firm.

Responsibilities:
· Prepare financial reports and statements
· Conduct analysis and modeling of investment opportunities
· Monitor and manage the financial performance of portfolio companies
· Perform ad hoc financial analysis as required
· Work closely with senior team members to support investment decisions
· Conduct industry research and analysis to identify trends and opportunities
· Assist with the preparation of investor reports and presentations
· Participate in due diligence efforts for potential acquisitions

Qualifications:
· Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, or related field
· 1-3 years of relevant experience, preferably from a Big 4 accounting firm
· Strong analytical skills and ability to work with large data sets
· Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
· Knowledge of financial modeling and valuation techniques
· Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
· Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently
· Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment

We offer a competitive salary package and the opportunity to work with a highly regarded team of professionals. If you are a driven and ambitious Financial Analyst looking for an exciting opportunity to grow your career, we encourage you to apply.

description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you’ll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for a world class Data Analyst to join our Regional team in Poland. The team is deployed in the top cities in Poland, leading our growth and working on delivering on our vision of giving everyone easy access to anything in every city in Poland.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

Develop and own scalable and reliable reporting tools for the Regional team, enabling the team to make decisions based on up to date and insightful data with a 360 view, including commercial, operational and financial KPIs.
Support the definition of targets and calculation of achievements both for the team and for single individuals, ensuring fair but challenging targets.
Track KPIs, identifying trends and factors that represent risks and opportunities, across areas such as Sales, Marketing & Growth, Operations, Profitability.
Perform ad hoc analyses and deep dives as required, owning them end to end: frame problem, identify and gather data, perform analysis, present insights and results with appropriate visualizations.
Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference
You Have

At least 2 years of experience in an analytical role, working with data to generate insights and make the right decisions
Used to work with ETL processes and gather data from different sources (APIs, Excel and other databases)
Advanced worksheet / modeling skills
Expertise in SQL - Redshift experience a plus
Knowledge of visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, QlikView, etc..
Previous experience in Python and with analysis tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Scikit, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R is a plus
Bachelor’s degree in a scientific or business discipline
Proficiency in English (written and communication) is a must. Proficiency in Polish desired.
Based in Warsaw, Kraków, Łódź, Wrocław, Gdańsk or Poznań
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits

Top-notch private health insurance
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!
Discounted gym memberships
Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)
Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!
Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
External learning tools
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo

Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly
Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly
Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning
Care: Uplift people and the planet
Glownership: Act as proud owners
High Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

description:
Dizparc söker ytterligare konsulter som kan stärka upp vårt redan kompetenta BI-team och hjälpa våra kunder att vara bäst! På Dizparc är vi inte fler än att varje medarbetare spelar en avgörande roll. Både för oss själva och för våra kunder.
Därför söker vårt Umeåkontor nu fler drivna personer som kommer till jobbet för att både utveckla och utvecklas. Vi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet och bred kunskap om BI-lösningar, modeller och datalager. Din tyngdpunkt kommer att ligga på att utveckla lösningar baserad på Microsoft-teknologier.
Den person vi söker blir vår seniora specialist inom området Business Intelligence. Vi tror att du har medverkat i mer än tio BI-implementationer byggd med Microsoftteknik och kan föreslå kundlösningar med hjälp av och tillsammans med dina nya kollegor. Du är väl förtrogen med Kimballmetodiken, datalager och Power BI. Vi jobbar främst med Azure som plattform eftersom vi tror att det är den bästa plattformen för BI och analys och Dizparc är partner till Microsoft inom området Data & AI.
Du jobbar både med tekniska lösningar och verksamhetsnära mot kund för att designa, modellera samt utveckla rapporterings- och analyslösningar för Dizparcs kunder. Teamet består av positiva och kunniga kollegor som gärna delar med sig av sina erfarenheter. Det finns goda möjligheter att bredda din kompetens snabbt då Dizparc har många kunder inom många olika branscher.
Vem är du?
Vi ser gärna att du har ett intresse för ny teknik och vilka möjligheter de digitala hjälpmedlen för med sig. Vi vill att du som person är engagerad och gillar att samarbeta med andra människor och att du kommunicerar på ett tydligt sätt. I arbetet är du noggrann och medveten om mål och tycker det är viktigt med kvalitet. Vi tror också att du trivs med att arbeta nära kund.
För tjänsten krävs flytande kunskaper i tal och skrift i svenska och goda kunskaper i engelska.
Det är meriterande är om du har:

Flerårig erfarenhet av business Intelligence, affärssystem och beslutsstöd.
Kunskap inom SQL, SQL Server och/eller andra databassystem
Arbetat med design och modellering av datalager
Kunskaper i Power BI eller andra analysverktyg
Erfarenhet av BI-implementationer i Microsoft Azure.
Erfarenhet av Azure Synapse Analytics och Azure i allmänhet.
Medverkat i flertalet BI-implementationer.
Vi har vårt kontor i Umeå och jobbar enligt konceptet hybrid flexarbetsplats.
Urval sker löpande och tillsättning av tjänsten görs när vi hittat rätt kandidat, även om ansökningstiden inte gått ut.
Vilka är vi?
Du kommer till ett företag som är ungt i sinnet men som har medarbetare med många års erfarenhet från branschen. Dizparc är ett företag där vi är engagerade i att hjälpa våra kunder att ta nästa steg i deras digitala utveckling. Vi arbetar tight tillsammans och delar gärna våra erfarenheter med varandra. Vår ambition är att alltid ligga i framkant och erbjuda de senaste lösningarna branschen har att erbjuda. Vi jobbar aktivt med att bygga en bra företagskultur och värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en bra balans mellan fritid och arbete.
linkedin_skills: Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Azure, SQL, Business Intelligence (BI), Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), and Analytics

description:
Farm21 is looking for Data Specialist who likes to work in a highly dynamic Agritech startup. While we currently have a small team, we are active in 15 countries.

Our online platform provides farmers with advice and actions needed for optimal crop production. Through this advice, fewer resources are used to achieve better yields; more efficiency, better returns; higher sustainability. Data sources we use for this include our own field sensors but also weather forecasts, soil information, satellite images, etc. It is up to the Data Analyst to build the data analytics and find the connection within the data.

In addition, our ambitions go beyond large farms. In the coming years, we will also work on propositions for small farmers in developing countries. They are responsible for 80% of the food consumed in developing countries. We believe they must be part of the digitisation of agriculture to solve the world food crisis. We can help increase their yields, giving them a better income and the world more food.

As a data analyst, you can make a huge impact on the agriculture sector, globally!

This role allows you to work on an infinity of possibilities, but within one platform. At Farm21, you get the time and space for depth, but every project requires a different approach and data set to work with.

Tasks

Farm21 aims to generate insights for farmers based on data. We're continuously looking for more and better data to help farmers make better decisions. Your tasks will include:

Combining different data sources.
Refinement of (sensor) data, and identifying gaps in data.
Generate insights and visualize/ interpret data using machine learning/deep-learning models.

Requirements

You

Have experience or a strong interest in arable farming
Knowledge of biological (plant) processes
Are always curious about learning new stuff
Identify good-quality data sources

Responsibilities

Work together in a team to generate useful insights from data
Identify good-quality data sources
Identify missing data
Build, test and maintain data models
Implementation of data models in a production environment

Qualifications

Fluent in English
Experience in the agricultural sector
Bachelor's degree/level or higher

Bonus

Experience in crop growth modeling
Experience in SQL/PostgreSQL
Experience in Python

Benefits

We offer:

Fantastic colleagues to work with, a young and dynamic team
A good salary
Provided lunch at the office
The opportunity to work both remotely and in the office (Amsterdam)

Does this suit you? Then apply quickly!
linkedin_skills: PostgreSQL, SQL, Data Models, Data Engineering, Data Modeling, Data Science, Databases, and English

description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that's what we're doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we've still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

Right now, we have more than 20 million users around the world. We work across 8 countries and 90 cities, adapting our product fast to be leaders in all of those markets and taking care about sustainability.

Our Data teams include an eclectic bunch of awesome and diverse people from different backgrounds who come together as collaborative and inclusive teams to push boundaries. Having a diverse and inclusive work environment is really important for us. That's why we like to count with different points of view in our team that help us to solve problems in a better way.

You will:

Leverage data to perform intensive analysis across all audiences of our business to improve operational efficiency and streamline processes.
Generate and execute on ideas for exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide recommendations for actions
Create dashboards and reports to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics
Use data visualization to distill complicated spatio-temporal data into easy to digest summaries that are used to monitor health and inform product
Present findings to senior management to guide business decisions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across disciplines such Operations, Growth, and Tech

Our Ideal candidate has:

Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
Graduate degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Economics, Statistics, or related fields
Working experience as a Data Analyst or Operations Analyst
Working experience in execution process optimization, measurement and follow up on customer-centric processes based on scalability and continuous improvement
Proficient in writing and understanding SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Lean Six Sigma. Certificate will be a plus
Working knowledge of Tableau or any other data visualization tool
Master degree on Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related will be a plus
Good communication skills and priorities identification
Fluency in English and Spanish

What's it like to work at Cabify?

We're a company full of happy, motivated people and we never want that to change. Here are some more reasons why it rocks to be part of our high-performance.

Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-38K€], L3 [35-48K€]
Recharge day: Every 3rd Friday monthly off!
Hybrid Model
Flexible work environment & hours
Regular team events
Cabify staff free rides
Personal development programs based on our career paths
Training programs
Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare
All the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent)
A pet room, so you don't have to leave your furry friend at home

Cabify is proud of being an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age or ability.

Join us!
linkedin_skills: Communication, Data Visualization, Key Metrics, Dashboards, Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, Visualization, Databases, and Statistics

description:
Als Joint Venture der Deutschen Bank und der ManpowerGroup besetzen wir seit 1998 erfolgreich Vakanzen in der Banken-, Finanz- und Versicherungsbranche. Wir schaffen Verbindungen und sind innerhalb dieser spezialisierten Branche bestens vernetzt. Profitieren Sie von unserem Netzwerk! Wir begleiten Sie bei Ihrem Wunsch nach einer beruflichen Veränderung und bieten Ihnen vielfältige Jobperspektiven.

Für unseren Kunden aus der Bankenwelt suchen wir SIEzum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunktals Mitarbeiter/in (gn) im Pay Control Center.Die Position ist im Rahmen der Arbeitnehmerüberlassungmit einem unbefristetem Arbeitsvertragbei Bankpower zu besetzen. Eine Übernahme ist nicht ausgeschlossen. Bewerben Sie sich jetzt und starten in Ihrem neuen Job durch. Der Lohn für dieses Stellenangebot liegt je nach Erfahrung und Qualifikationen zwischen 4000€ und 5000€ im Monat.

Ihre Benefits Bei Unserem Kunden

Übertarifliche Vergütung
Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag
Sehr gute Erreichbarkeit mit den öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln
Moderner Arbeitsplatz
Homeoffice nach Absprache (2-3 Tage)

Bearbeitung von 1st Level Verdachtsfällen im Zahlungsverkehr
Fristgerechte Bearbeitung von Zahlungsausgängen
Verantwortung von Fallbearbeitungen (EURO check und Financial Sanctions Monitoring)
Freigabe von Transaktionen
Unterstützung des laufenden Betriebs

Das Bringen Sie Mit

Abgeschlossene Ausbildung zum Bankkaufmann (gn) oder ein wirtschaftswissenschaftliches Studium
Erste Erfahrungen in den Themen Financial Sanctions Monitoring sowie 100mEUR check sind wünschenswert
Gute Kenntnisse im internationalen Zahlungsverkehr sind von Vorteil
Genaues und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten auch unter Zeitdruck
Hohes Engagement und Qualitätsbewusstsein
Hohe Kundenorientierung und Kommunikationsfähigkeit
Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Bereitschaft zu Schichtarbeit im Zeitraum von 8:00 bis 19:00 Uhr und gegebenenfalls an Feiertagen

Ihr Weg Zum Neuen Job

Wenn Sie sich hier wiedererkennen, freuen wir uns über Ihre aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen inklusive Ihrer Gehaltsangabe sowie Ihrer Verfügbarkeit via E-Mail an jobsinmuenchen@bankpower.de.

Alle personenbezogenen Formulierungen in dieser Stellenanzeige sind geschlechtsneutral zu betrachten.

Selbstverständlich behandeln wir Ihre Bewerbung mit absoluter Diskretion.

Wir freuen uns auf Sie!

description:
About the company:
NOOS Digital is an agency specialized in digital business development. We started the company with the idea of bridging the gap between executive management and operations in digital transformation and acceleration. We define our offer in strategy, analysis, and project management in order to improve our clients digital operations. Currently, we work on exciting assignments with Djerf Avenue, Sneakers n Stuff, Stadium, Scandinavian Photo.

NOOS strives to always be data-driven, insightful, goal-oriented, and innovative in our assignments. Our projects are delivered with dignity and we are passionate about creating long-term and sustainable growth for and together with our clients. Our ambition is to create an outstanding agency that is ub top level of the competition of what we do. For us, being the best means continuously challenging ourselves, our clients, and our projects to a level where we consistently exceed our clients expectations.

Read more about us atwww.noosdigital.com

About the position:
As a Data Analyst at NOOS, you will be a part of our Data and Insight Team and have the opportunity to help us develop our offering within Insight and Strategy. This makes you a central part of NOOS, where you work closely with our consultants to deliver the best results for our clients.

By nature, you are an analytical and structured profile who bridges the gap between business and technology in your analytical capabilities. You are skilled at translating data into insights and drawing conclusions from them. We place great importance on your ability to collaborate, flexibility and a solution-oriented mindset.

In your work, you will be challenged in various areas related to retail business development and digital transformation. We work from different perspectives depending on the customer and business we encounter. In this role, your responsibility, together with the team, will be to support projects of various natures from start to finish in close collaboration with the client.

Skills:

Strong Excel skills.
Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics.
Knowledge or experience working in BI.
Skills in SQL, Python, Node.js.
Interpretation of large data sets.
Understanding of how we translate insights into recommendations.
An interest and curiosity in business development and business analysis.

Education:

Business Economics.
Industrial Economics.
Or equivalent academic education.

We offer:

The opportunity to be part of building tomorrow's management agency.
The opportunity to work with clients of different characters and with different challenges and conditions to create a successful digital business together.
Colleagues with a vast knowledge base in digital business and strong internal knowledge sharing.
Attractive benefits.
Office in central Stockholm.
Competitive salary conditions (pension, wellness allowance, etc.).
Flexible work environment with the possibility to work partially remote.
Several company activities.

description:
AGCO is a global leader focused on the design, manufacture and distribution of agricultural machinery and infrastructure. As a Fortune 500 company and one of the global leaders in agricultural equipment manufacturing, we have an extensive network of over 9,200 dealers and serve more than 140 countries. While headquartered in Duluth, Georgia, AGCO has manufacturing facilities all over the world creating and distributing their full-line of products, including Challenger, Fendt, GSI, Massey Ferguson, and Valtra. Visit www.AGCOcorp.com for more information.

Financial Accountant / Analyst

Budapest, Hungary

We are looking for enthusiastic junior professionals to join our growing Financial Accountant/Analystteams in order to provide best class service to AGCO colleagues worldwide.

The junior financial accountant/analyst is responsible for the financial accountancy or analysis processes as part of the R2R organization in our Shared Service Center in Budapest and provides support for the entities under Budapest R2R team.

Your Impact

Completing month end close tasks within the agreed deadlines
Preparing accruals and posting them in SAP / OneStream
Analyze month end reports
Detect and notify unsuccessful payments. Assist to resolve unsuccessful payments.
Creation of manual payment instructions in several Bank Portals
Conducts data entry of accounting entries into the system and ensures data integrity

What You Will Bring

Bachelor degree in Finance or business (or similar)
0-2 years of relevant experience
Good MS Excel knowledge
Able to communicate in English

A Plus If You Have

SAP knowledge
Analytical skills
SSC reporting / GL accounting area experience
FASS/KPMG PBC List preparations experience

What We Offer

Working in international environment, possibility to grow global network
Additional benefits (Private medical insurance / Competetive cafeteria package / Employee assistance program, etc.)

If you are looking for an opportunity to work in an inspiring dynamic multinational environment for a leading global player of agricultural solutions, we look forward to receiving your application in English language (incl. your CV, motivation letter and earliest possible start date) via our career website: http://careers.agcocorp.com. For more information about AGCO, please visit www.AGCOcorp.com.

We offer you appropriate perspectives and personal as well as professional development possibilities

More people. More food. More farm productivity.

It's a simple but compelling growth opportunity for AGCO and for your career.

Join AGCO to grow your career. We are Leading the Way. Together.

AGCO - MAKE YOUR LIFE DIFFERENT

description:
We’re looking for the right candidate to join our Business Data Analyst team and become part of a fast-growing company that is on always on the look for people that will demonstrate they’re able to grow with the company. As the role is our entry level, this is a great entry point for a career path at Lokad, either as a future technical expert or as manager.

We help companies in different verticals (aerospace, automotive, ecommerce…) to forecast and make decisions about their inventory. The vast majority of our clients are based outside of France, mainly in North America and Europe.

As a Business Data Analyst (or Supply Chain Scientist in Lokad's terminology), your role is to make sure our clients get the most from Lokad's technology. The role is a mix between technology, data crunching and supply chain expertise. You will address complex supply chain issues and craft quantitative strategies. Your goal is not only to advise your clients on strategies to adopt, but to craft and execute these strategies on a daily basis while leveraging the data available as much as possible. Your goal is also to keep refining these strategies over time to keep them aligned with the needs of our clients.

At Lokad, you will benefit from the extensive training and coaching of our expert team. You will gain skills in supply chain, predictive analysis and overall quantitative optimization for business. You will learn how to achieve measurable business results grounded on scientific analysis of data.

About one quarter of your time is spent interacting with clients in order to better understand their business (mainly over the phone or by mail, with occasional travels). Note that, in order to benefit from your colleagues expertise, you won't be required to work on the customers' premises.

The rest of your time is spent on data analysis, including manipulating and cleaning data, setting up forecasts, economic optimization, reporting and data vizualisation. In order to do this, you'll learn to use our Differentiable Programming tools and a DSL (Envision) developped by Lokad.

We are looking for candidates with the following skills and qualities:

A strong engineering background.
A keen interest in data and quantitative analysis in general.
Good Excel skills or programming skills (e.g. Python, VBA, SQL, etc.).
Impeccable command of English( French is optional).
Excellent communication skills and telephone manners.
A well-made head, rather than a well-filled head.We are not looking for someone who is already an expert in supply chain or programming. We’re looking for a fast learner, with an ability to quickly grasp technology and concepts, since our technology is by no means a simple and plug-and-play product. Knowledge or understanding of supply chain would be a bonus, but the ability to quickly assess and grasp a new situation or get a clear picture of how an organization works and what are the pain points is what we are really after.
Candidates must be self-motivated, confident and highly driven to achieve results with a “hands on” attitude.

The role is predominantly office based, although some travel will be occasionally required to customers, partners or events. We are located in the very center of Paris, France (station Chevaleret).
linkedin_skills: Data Analysis, English, Python (Programming Language), Communication, Analytical Skills, Supply Chain Optimization, Programming, Supply Chain Management, and Customer Service

description:
L’un de nos clients est à la recherche d’un(e) Administrateur Systèmes de reporting (Finance) H/F à Paris (17e). Rémunération : 40 000/44 000€ (selon votre profil).

VOTRE ENVIRONNEMENT ?

Grand équipementier automobile, la structure est aujourd’hui partenaire de tous les constructeurs dans le monde.

Entreprise technologique, le Groupe propose des systèmes et équipements innovants permettant la réduction des émissions de CO2 et le développement de la conduite intuitive.

L’entreprise fournit également des pièces de rechange aux constructeurs automobile et aux acteurs du marché de la rechange indépendante.

VOTRE QUOTIDIEN ?

En tant qu’Administrateur Systèmes de reporting (Finance)H/F, vous souhaitez évoluer au sein d’un cadre organisé, dynamique et collectif, alors ce poste est fait pour vous !

Dans le cadre de cette fonction, vos différentes tâches seront les suivantes :

Vous préparez des outils pour les reportings mensuels, budgétaires et business plan
Vous apportez un support aux utilisateurs finaux lors de la clôture
Vous coordonnez la gestion des incidents (problèmes de connexion...) avec le prestataire d'hébergement pour l’analyse et mise en œuvre des demandes d'évolution
Vous développez et mettez en œuvre de modules de formation dédiés aux utilisateurs finaux (1400 utilisateurs)
Vous animez et formez les utilisateurs finaux (formations en présentiel et online)
Vous mettez en place des processus et des procédures d'amélioration continue
Vous mettez en place et gérez des indicateurs de performance et de qualité du département Reporting
Vous participez aux projets d'évolution des outils
Vous contribuez au programme d'éthique et de conformité du Groupe en appliquant et en respectant le code d'éthique et les politiques de l’entreprise
Bien évidemment, vous bénéficierez de l’encadrement complète de la structure, ainsi que les différents formations internes.

Les Avantages

Des chèques cadeaux de 450 € (Attribués 2 fois dans l’année)
600 € de dépenses culturelles
Les formations internes Groupe
Du télétravail (1 à 2 jours par semaine)
ET VOUS DANS TOUT CA ?

Issu(e) d'une formation Bac+5 minimum, vous êtes fort(e) d’une première expérience réussie dans le secteur de la Finance, sur une activité similaire.

Vous êtes opérationnel(le) en anglais (écrit et oral).

Enfin, vous êtes organisé(e), avec un bon sens relationnel et de l'analyse, alors ce poste est fait pour vous.

Avez-vous déjà pensé à devenir consultant(e) en recrutement ?

Deux fois Great Place to Work, Walters People a reçu 5 étoiles dans le classement des Meilleurs Cabinets de Recrutement du journal Les Echos (catégories: Travail Temporaire et Managers et Spécialistes).

Nous avons de nombreuses opportunités à pourvoir dans nos équipes, n’hésitez plus, rejoignez-noushttps://www.walterspeople.fr/nous-rejoindre.html

description:
Si te apasiona la moda sport y el deporte, en ISRG tenemos mucho que ofrecerte: te damos la oportunidad de desarrollar tu carrera en el grupo líder del retail deportivo multimarca en España, Portugal y Países Bajos, en un proyecto en constante crecimiento y un entorno basado en la cooperación y el respeto mutuo, con un fuerte compromiso por la diversidad y la igualdad de oportunidades.

Gracias a Sprinter, JD Sports, Sport Zone, Size?, Perrysport, Aktiesport, Bodytone y Deporvillage, contamos con más de 500 tiendas y 10.000 personas que forman parte de esta familia en constante expansión internacional.

Nuestros procesos de selección tienen como objetivo identificar el mejor talento y motivación, con un modelo de gestión por competencias, donde valoramos muy positivamente las experiencias de voluntariado, sociales y del ámbito doméstico.

¿Te unes al equipo?

Misión:

Como Data Analyst te encargará de mantener las herramientas del área de negocio de merchandising, revisar de forma sistemática los resultados de las ejecuciones, atender las peticiones de las personas usuarias de negocio, localizar cualquier incidencia/área de mejora y trasladar las peticiones (una vez calificadas) a los equipos de trabajo.

Funciones:

Diseño y elaboración de KPIs específicos requeridos por negocio y/o la matriz del grupo. (P.ejm: Velocidad Venta Producto Tienda Vs Web)
Realizar/mantener modelos de previsión de demanda, para ayudar al equipo de Merchandising/Compras a estimar las cantidades necesarias.
Análisis del histórico de la BBDD con alto volumen de datos con el objetivo de generar modelos de predicción en las áreas requeridas.
Análisis de producto (ciclo de vida del pricing, márgenes, etc…)
Análisis y segmentación del tipo de cliente (CRM) con el objetivo de ayudar al departamento de Marketing a realizar acciones dirigidas.
Ajuste y mejora del algoritmo de reposición y cobertura de Stock.
Soporte técnico de programas informáticos relacionados con la gestión de stock y pricing de productos, basados en Machine Learning (predicción de la demanda, segmentación, pricing, optimización ).
Elaboración de cuadros de mando para la toma de decisiones a nivel corporativo.
Identificación de áreas de mejora.
Supervisión diaria de resultados.
Desarrollos incrementales a las aplicaciones en producción.
Resolución de incidencias.
Trasladar las peticiones, incidencias y/o mejoras al departamento de Proyectos y Operaciones para la puesta en producción de las mismas.

Requisitos:

Grado, Diplomatura o Licenciatura en estadística, matemáticas, Ingeniería informática o en estudios similares
Tener conocimientos de SQL avanzado.
Nivel muy alto en SAS.
Python Avanzado.
Conocimiento en SAP.
Buen nivel de inglés (B2).
Experiencia mínima de al menos 2 años en puesto similar.

Valorable:

Valorable Python u otros lenguajes de programación.
Nivel alto de otras lenguas: italiano, francés, portugués, holandés…

Todas las personas serán consideradas sin importar su identidad de género, orientación sexual, etnia, religión, edad o grado de discapacidad.

Porcentaje sobre objetivos.

Plan de desarrollo personalizado y carrera en un entorno internacional.
Formación continua tanto en hard skills y soft skills.

description:
Het zijn roerige tijden in de markt voor fusies en overnames; hoge inflatie, oplopende rentes en de nasleep van supply chain problematiek. Ondanks deze ontwikkelingen kan Catapult Corporate Finance de vraag naar haar diensten met moeite bijbenen. Daarom breiden wij ons team uit met onder meer (junior) business analysts.

Over Catapult Corporate Finance
Catapult Corporate Finance werkt voor opdrachtgevers die voor wezenlijke beslissingen in hun bedrijfsvoering staan. Of het nou gaat om gedeeltelijke of algehele verkoop van het bedrijf, de acquisitie van een concurrent, of het aantrekken van (groei)kapitaal; in al deze fases spelen de specialisten van Catapult een cruciale rol. Wij hebben een indrukwekkendtrack recordvan transacties in het hogere MKB-segment, in zowel binnen- als buitenland. Als processpecialist zijn wij werkzaam in vrijwel alle sectoren: productie (kunststof, staal, steen, hout), software/ICT, logistiek, handel, en alle denkbare vormen van dienstverlening.

De functie
Als (junior) business analyst verzamel je, al dan niet met een collega, relevante informatie en voer je (financiële) analyses uit. Je identificeert risico’s en kansen, komt met werkbare oplossingen en bijbehorende acties met tijdspad. In teamverband werk je doorgaans aan meerdere opdrachten tegelijk. Jouw functie is veelzijdig en varieert per opdracht, afhankelijk van de situatie van de klant en de rol die Catapult heeft.
Je maakt deel uit van het transactieteam. Je werkt aan waarderings- en financieringsvraagstukken, voert financiële analyses uit en stelt informatie- en financieringsmemoranda samen. Daarnaast ondersteun je het transactieproces, heb je contact met diverse partijen en ondersteun je het onderhandelingsteam. Je wordt aangemoedigd om initiatief te nemen en probleemoplossend te denken, met een gezonde dosis creativiteit.
Je bent vanaf het begin een integraal onderdeel van een overzichtelijk en hecht team, met een grote mate van vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Je verantwoordelijkheden nemen al snel toe en je zult direct en actief worden betrokken bij onder andere transacties, transities en financieringsvraagstukken.
De uiteenlopende situaties eisen proactief en zelfstandig handelen, niet zelden onder tijdsdruk. Je leert bij Catapult ‘on the job’. Kortom, een unieke leerschool en een kickstart voor jouw carrière.
Aanvullend zul je na enige tijd de mogelijkheid krijgen om mee te werken aan een bedrijfsherstructurering of deel uitmaken van een turnaround team. Je ondersteunt jouw senior collega’s met (financiële) analyses op basis waarvan essentiële keuzes worden gemaakt.

Wie zoeken wij
Je bent een jonge professional met flair en eigenheid. Een autonome denker met verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel en werklust. Een teamspeler met sterke financiële en analytische vaardigheden en een oplossingsgerichte instelling. Je bent proactief en hebt een scherp oog voor detail. Je begrijpt het belang van betrouwbare kwantitatieve en financiële inzichten, passend bij onze bijzonder hoge kwaliteitsnormen.
Je bent net afgestudeerd of je hebt net je eerste jaren relevante werkervaring opgedaan. Je hebt een Master degree in Finance, Economie, Econometrie, (Technische) Bedrijfskunde, Accounting of een andere vergelijkbare studie. Werk- en/of stage-ervaring binnen een corporate finance, private equity, transaction services of accountancy omgeving is een pré. Uitgebreide kennis van Excel is een must.
Je kiest bewust voor de unieke mogelijkheden die Catapult biedt. Je wilt aan transacties werken, en betrokken worden op de momenten dat je kunt leren van ervaren specialisten.
Ondernemerschap spreekt je aan en je bent geïnteresseerd in wat mensen drijft. Je beschikt over uitstekende sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden. Een flexibele instelling is een voorwaarde. Je bent bereid je in de breedte verder te ontwikkelen en de handen uit de mouwen te steken.

Wat biedt Catapult
Een unieke omgeving om de meest uiteenlopende bedrijfssituaties en sectoren te leren kennen. Een intensieve leerschool met steile leercurve, om door te groeien binnen Catapult of als basis voor een functie in het bedrijfsleven. Wij investeren volop in de ontwikkeling van het team. We verwachten dat je alle ruimte pakt.
Onze primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn meer dan marktconform. Daarnaast hechten wij veel aandacht aan persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling van onze teamleden.
Catapult kent een informele en betrokken cultuur. Wij werken vanuit ons prachtige pand aan de IJssel in Deventer.

description:
Job Introduction

We are currently seeking a highly motivated Culinary Data Assistantforan 18months FTCto join our central Food Platform team and help establish Sodexo as the culinary leader in the UK & Ireland marketplace. As the Culinary Data Assistant, you will play an integral role in the successful and consistent implementation of our Food Management System (FMS) through recipe and menu transfer, compliance management, and future development for core, retail, and segment requirements. You will work closely with the Culinary team and various stakeholders to ensure that the FMS is fully developed, deployed, and maintained within the agreed framework, while delivering excellence through the FMS.

To be successful in this role you will have great communication skills, be a highly motivated individual with a broad understanding of the catering industry and a sound knowledge of different basic cookery principles.

Come and be a part of our exciting journey towards culinary excellence and make a positive impact on our customers and clients. Apply now to join our team!

Role Responsibility

Transfer of data to the FMS in line with the DRIVE project strategy
Support the process for managing expectations to support segments
Ensure full collaboration with all teams impacted by role
Support the Co-ordination of alignment of recipe and menu development protocols and processes
Liaise with central and segment peer group to ensure all are fully aligned to FMS and Drive systems
Work inside the framework of best practice for culinary excellence when developing recipe and menu content
Fully support the culinary team to effectively test the robustness of all recipes and menus prior to launch
Liaise with design team, central culinary team and segment executive teams to execute briefs effectively
Establish strong working relations with all relevant stakeholders to ensure the most successful and effective use of the role

The Ideal Candidate

Highly motivated data inputter with a good level of catering experience in industry including system management
Experience in recipe and menu creation
Broad understanding and sound knowledge of different basic cookery principles
Computer literate and a good working knowledge of Food Management Systems
Strong self-motivational skills with proven track record of delivery to deadlines
The ability to interpret and translate new developments in a structured manner to ensure the project continues
Strong influencing and relationship building skills with wide range of stakeholders
Must be able to work with competing demands
Ability to manage a number of different projects at the same time including the allocation of resources as appropriate to deliver to timescales and deadlines
Strong listening and influencing skills with proven effectiveness in successfully working as part of a project team
Strong communication and rational decision making skills

Desirable

A background in recipe, menu, and concept design
Product development within various sectors
Proven track record in supporting the development of projects
SME Experience within a number of segments within foodservice/contract catering market
Development and Training background

About The Company

In the UK and Ireland, Sodexo employs around 30,000 people, and partners with clients in many sectors across business and industry; schools and universities; sports and leisure; energy and resources; government and agencies; healthcare; justice and defence.

Sodexo’s connected; people-centric approach brings together a diverse range of expertise. The breadth of services it offers ranges from food and hospitality; cleaning; reception; concierge ( Circles ); security; property management and technical services through to data driven workplace strategy and design ( Wx ); employee engagement and recognition services ( Sodexo Engage ) and personal home services through Prestige Nursing + Care and the Good Care Group.

Vital Spaces is Sodexo’s value proposition that puts people at the heart of everything we do, bringing together services and solutions and focusing on the productivity and wellbeing of people wherever they are.

Sodexo is committed to being an inclusive employer; we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds and identities.

We’re a Disability Confident Leader employer. We’re committed to changing attitudes towards disability, and making sure disabled people have the chance to fulfil their aspirations.

We are building on our support to the Armed Forces community through the development of specific pathways within our recruitment process to  support ex-forces personnel and reservists, those applying for jobs with us who meet the ideal candidate criteria for the role advertised are guaranteed to progress to the selection process

Sodexo

description:
12 Month Contract

Your team

The Paddy Power Sports Team is responsible for the overall revenue for the online Paddy Power Sports business. We are tasked with defining and ensuring consistent delivery of a customer led proposition to grow our share in the UK and Irish market.

This role will report to the Senior Performance & Analytics Manager, Paddy Power Sports. The overall purpose of the role is to provide insights to help grow the customer base of the Paddy Power online business via acquisition and retention.

What you’ll do

Investigate, analyse and provide recommendations on key areas of customer lifecycle
Lead customer growth performance to understand growth drivers, trends and customer behaviours. Ensuring that the customer is central to our decision-making process.
Supporting strategic, deep dive analysis to drive recommendations on how we can better deliver against the PP customer growth strategy
Working with the Digital Acquisition team to manage and optimise digital media spend and updating partners on the performance of PP overall marketing spend
Evaluate and understand the drivers of all Sports revenue streams.
Show how customer experience and interactions impact performance.
Encourage a data led approach to the decision-making process across commercial team.

How you’ll do it

Skilled at assimilating numerous sources of information to make or change decisions
Ability to prioritise and focus on what really matters and to communicate these decisions in a timely manner
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) with ability to communicate effectively at all levels within the business
Strong personal presence and presentation; ability to feel comfortable when surrounded by senior partners and speak with confidence
Ability to build successful relationships and positively influence people – including direct reports, peers and partners
Team player with personal characteristics that engender trust and confidence

About PaddyPower

Work that makes play jealous

Paddy Power has been breaking and re-writing the rules since 1988, from on-track bookmakers to cheeky upstart mischief-makers, to part of the largest betting and gaming technology company in the world.

Although we’ve grown to the betting behemoth we are today, we’ve not forgotten our roots. We continue to offer great value and entertainment to our customers and keep them at the heart of what we do.

Our culture of hard work, boldness and an innovative spirit got us to where we are and we take our work seriously, but not ourselves! We win by having the best people working well together. Don’t pigeon-hole us either – our company is a mix of sports nuts, gaming innovators, tech geniuses, perceptive people-people, inspiring leaders… and a very busy legal team.

We’ve got a growing squad of specialists, and we make the work fun. Sound good? Maybe there’s a spot on the team for you!

Plus, PaddyPower is part of the Flutter UK & Ireland family – a collection of big-hitting entertainment brands such as Betfair, Sky Betting & Gaming and Tombola.

What we’ll offer you

£1,000 learning fund
Unlimited holiday
Twice-yearly bonus (with part of it guaranteed!)
Pension contribution scheme
Private healthcare
Flexible ways of working – home or office, it’s your choice!
Access to thousands of Udemy courses
Invest via the Company Sharesave Scheme
16 hours paid volunteering time per year

We’re working to be an inclusive employer, and we encourage people from all backgrounds, ways of thinking and working to apply. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences; you don't have to meet all the requirements listed to apply for this role.
If you need any adjustments to make this role work for you let us know, and we’ll see how we can accommodate them

description:
Excellent company culture|Strategic data analysis

About Our Client

Our client is the driving force behind the recycling of household packaging in Belgium. Every day,they work with public and private partners to create a circular economy for household packaging, from collection among the general public to sustainable recycling in our own country.

Job Description

You have a central role in order to ensure right observations, conclusions and decisions across the business; from upstream (members, total market) to downstream operations (collection and recycling).

With a critical eye you contribute to various internal and external reports.
You provide our internal and external clients with actionable and easily interpretable reports and dashboards that support them in their decision making.
Through your knowledge and your insights in our data, you monitor and report on data quality.
You have a permanent view on external data which can help us enriching our own data.
You follow up your projects in an autonomous and efficient way.
As member of the Data Team, you help spread the data story throughout the organization so that data stays top of mind within the company

The Successful Applicant

you have a university degree (or equal by experience); with at least 5 years of work experience;
You have a profound knowledge of excel
You have a basic knowledge of applied statistics;
You have experience with BI reporting;
You speak fluent French or Dutch with a good knowledge of the other language.
You have an analytical mind, you work in an accurate and structured way;
You are a strong problem solver
you are a teamplayer
You are an autodidact

What's On Offer

Working in a company focusing on growth of their employees

Working with passionate team members

Working directly with top management

Competitive salary package

description:
This is the perfect opportunity if you have passion for Data, Analytics & E-commerce. You get enthusiastic about providing actionable insights to improve our users’ experience & e-commerce performance. We are looking for 2(!) Data Analysts who will join us in our journey to become a truly data-driven e-commerce company. We work in agile product teams, where product owners, developers, data analysts, UX & CRO specialists are working closely together and fully focus on their product. With 3 E-commerce data analysts already in the team & a data analyst community of > 50 colleagues across the group, we’re sure you will get challenged to keep learning and look forward to your contribution!

During the last years we have spent a lot of time on the implementation of the Google Analytics 360 suite and Tableau. The implementation gives us great insights in our visitors & customers’ digital behaviour. Think about what you can analyze and contribute to our business with access to all our click, customer, product- & sales data of >50k (recurring) customers, >500k products and >1 billion of yearly turnover data. We are looking for the person who is always looking for the question behind the question, can combine & extract data from multiple sources and is comfortable in translating these into actionable insights and presenting this to stakeholders.

The role

You will enable product teams to make decisions from the data lens, by conducting in-depth analysis and creating insights through dashboarding.
You will analyze and monitor the development of our e-commerce KPI’s, the progress of our objectives & key results (OKR’s) and translate these into insights.
Support multiple teams in working with OKR’s by defining metrics, baseline measurements & targets. Then validate & analyze the impact for all improvements we create in our digital experience (such as pre-post analysis and/or experimentation analysis).
Build relationships with stakeholders to establish yourself as the expert for data insights & web analytics expertise, working together with the other analysts in different teams to continuously improve our maturity in data-driven decision making.
You are responsible for our key journeys, such as findability of items, delivery communication & check-out. A very challenging opportunity!

Who are you?

Completed bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant professional area.
At least 4 years of experience as an analyst in e-commerce/digital companies.
Good communication and advisory skills (written and spoken).
Strong experience with web analytics like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics or similar tooling.
Experience with dashboarding and data visualization.
Strong ability to extract actionable insights from advanced analyses and being able to advise on possible next steps.
Preferably you have experience with Python, SQL & Google BigQuery (we provide room for training & personal development to learn).
You live in the Netherlands, near Utrecht or Varsseveld, because we work at least once a week together at our office in Utrecht and also at our main office in Varsseveld.
Since the working language in our team is Dutch, we prefer candidates who are fluent in Dutch, both verbally and in writing.

What do we offer?

We are an ambitious, fast growing and financially sound organization. Therefore, you can expect a few important things from us. We value personal development a lot and thus we offer great budget for courses and trainings. Besides a competitive monthly salary we also offer:

37 holidays
A lot of room for growth and entrepreneurship
Profit sharing bonus scheme
Flexible working hours and location
Laptop and working from home package
Generous pension plan

Who are we?

Johan Kramp started in 1951 from his garage in Varsseveld. When cycling he crossed borders to Germany: the beginning of the international millions company we are nowadays. We still follow the principles of Johan Kramp, but in time of today. Thanks to our ambitions we are active throughout Europe: a leading position in the agricultural market for parts. We heavily invest in E-Business and innovations. Our aim is to make it easy for our customers to run their business.

Working at Kramp means working with more than 3.000 international colleagues. Despite our size, we retained our family culture. Colleagues describe our culture as warm, friendly and informal. Entrepreneurship is in our DNA, but it's allowed to make mistakes. Trust and responsibility is what our colleagues value in Kramp as their employer.

Procedure

In case you feel challenged by above role description and requirements, we’re interested in meeting you! Please use the application button and send your CV and motivation letter.

Location

Varsseveld (NL) / Utrecht (NL)

Contact

Do you have a question about this vacancy? Please don’t hesitate to contact Bob Veurman, Manager E-business Marketing.

E: bob.veurman@kramp.com

Varsseveld (NL)

Location:

Varsseveld (NL)

description:
Data Analyst - H/F - Alternance 12 mois.

Ce poste basé à MERIGNAC est à pourvoir à partir de 01/09/2023 pour une durée de 12 mois.

#

Concrètement votre quotidien ?

Dans votre mission au sein de l'équipe Etudes transverses du pôle Pilotage Economique du risque France, vous serez en charge de :

Travailler sur la détection de la fraude en explorant l'ensemble des datas à disposition
Explorer les données d'open data et d'open banking
Réaliser des études risque sur le périmètre France à la demande de la direction des risques France, des responsables risque locaux crédit moderne ou du risque central.
Garantir la réalisation du Score monitoring France, demandée par le centre de scoring de RISK PF et pour les équipes des politiques d’acceptation.
Garantir la mise à jour des indicateurs risque demandés par les équipes ALMT front office & titrisation.
Répondre ponctuellement aux demandes du risque central sur leur besoins d’indicateurs demandés par le groupe BNPP ou par le régulateur.

Vous serez en interaction avec les différents services de la Direction des risques mais aussi d'autres directions pour répondre à leurs problématiques data et d’analyse. Vous aurez en charge de définir précisément le besoin et le périmètre de l’étude en partenariat avec le demandeur. Vous réaliserez les extractions de données nécessaires pour les exploiter et répondre à la problématique de l’analyse. Vous restituerez vos résultats d’analyses par le biais de messages clairs et saurez préconiser des solutions métier ou business

Les missions c’est important, l’équipe et l’environnement aussi !

Au sein de la Direction des Risques France, en tant que chargé(e) d’études risque transverses, vous intègrerez une équipe de 10 personnes multi-sites (Levallois / Mérignac). Le manager est basé à Mérignac.

Vous serez dans un environnement en open-space flex-office avec télétravail.

Des déplacements ponctuels inter-sites pourront avoir lieu ponctuellement.

Et après...?

En intégrant ce poste, vous approfondirez vos compétences data, risque et business au cours de votre expérience à la Direction des Risques France. Vous communiquerez en transverse avec l’ensemble de la Direction dans un but de partage des résultats de vos analyses. Vous serez en interaction avec des interlocuteurs de tous niveaux au sein de la Direction des Risques.

Vous intègrerez la communauté Data de PF France dotée d'une centaine de membres dans les métiers en relation avec la Data, ce qui vous permettra d'élargir votre réseau et vos connaissances Data au-delà du risque.

Et la rémunération ?

Encadrée par la loi, elle sera abordée à l’issue de votre parcours de recrutement. Elle dépend du type de contrat, votre âge et de votre niveau d’études.

Pourquoi BNP Paribas ?

Notre monde change : notre manière de nous informer, de consommer… et de travailler aussi ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues.

Bref, de tracer son propre chemin, différent, responsable et durable.

Chez BNP Paribas, nous recrutons nos collaborateurs avec l’idée qu’ils nous aideront à concevoir le monde et la banque de demain.

Vous voulez connaître toutes les raisons de nous rejoindre ? Rendez-vous sur www.bnpparibas.com

Etes-vous notre prochain Alternant(e) Data analyst ?

Nombre d'années d'expérience dans le domaine du poste : Débutant

Niveau d'étude souhaité : Master ou équivalent (>4 ans)

Vous avez des connaissances en matière de Data, Modèles prédictifs, Modèles Descriptifs, Analyse de données.

Et vous maitrisez les OUTILS DE MODELISATION STATISTIQUES, OUTILS DE PROGRAMMATION, OUTILS DE REQUETE

Votre adaptabilité, votre capacité à collaborer et analyser seront des atouts essentiels. Ajoutez à cela, une bonne capacité d'organisation et de communication qui finiront de nous convaincre.

Dans un monde qui change, la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des valeurs clés pour le bien-être et la performance des équipes.

Chez BNP Paribas, nous souhaitons accueillir et retenir tous les talents sans distinction :c’est ainsi que nous construirons, ensemble, la finance de demain, innovante, responsable et durable.

Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle.

À tout moment pendant le processus de recrutement, les informations figurant sur votre CV, vos données d'identification et vos antécédents pourront être vérifiés.

N'oubliez pas d'indiquer sur votre CV la formation que vous souhaitez préparer dans le cadre de votre alternance.

#Rejoignez-nous !
