description:
Together let's make ITALY great again, my client is seeking a highly motivated Renewable Financial Analyst to join their team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for renewable energy and a strong background in financial analysis.

About Company: Italian Developer, already operating for close to 3 years they have very ambitious growth plans, only apply if you want to be challenged and make a real change!

The ideal candidate should be passionate about finance, technology, innovation and renewables as a whole, to help make the

'switch' for a more sustainable future and longer lasting planet.

The Role

Our finance team is looking for a highly motivated financial analyst who has interest in joining a high performing team to drive company forward on its journey to a clean energy future. The individual will be responsible for supporting project finance and conducting financial analyses of all projects.

Develop financial models and providing financial forecasts
Be responsible for the project finance model and ad hoc amendments
Prepare monthly financial reports that monitor cash flow, identify trends in spending
Analyse project costs and preparing estimates for new projects
Work with management to develop budgets and forecast future revenue and expenses
Report to and work closely with the CFO
Work closely with the Development team
Assess and report on project returns and profitability
Maintain transaction data books for projects
Verify project inputs in financial models with the Development team and analysis of market conditions
Help prepare presentations at key milestones in project lifecycle
Provide analytical support to various groups internally
Closely follow industry trends and competitors
Other ad-hoc tasks as they arise

Requirements

Excellent knowledge of Excel and proven ability to navigate and manipulate Excel based financial models
Experience with statistical analysis and financial forecasting
Attention to detail and the ability to identify data patterns
Good verbal and written communication skills
Knowledge of renewable energy or energy project finance (a plus)
Knowledge of Excel (required) and VBA coding (a plus)
Able to work autonomously and as part of a team
Fluent in English, proficient in Italian

Qualifications/Experience

Bachelor's degree, ideally in finance or a quantitative field
Proven experience in similar role
Understanding of principles of finance

Location:Milan

Salary:£30,000 TO £40,000 euros per annum

This is a great opportunity to join an expanding business in the renewable energy sector in a strategically important position for the company

If like me you feel passionately about the fight for climate change and moving towards a zero-carbon world then reach out to me: d.ogunsola@ewi-group.com

ewi is committed to equality in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. ewi is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

description:
Ce poste basé à MONTREUIL SOUS BOIS est à pourvoir à partir de 01/09/2023 pour une durée de 12 mois.

Concrètement votre quotidien ?

Vos principales missions seront de :

Contribuer à l'analyse des besoins du management et des départements d’ITGC en matière de tableaux de bord de pilotage des activités projets et run (suivi des activités, sourcing et qualité des données, suivi budgétaire, alertes à remonter, etc.).
Concevoir en conséquence des reportings et de les paramétrer avec des outils de DataViz (Dataiku, Tableau software), et à en assurer la production et la mise à disposition régulière.
Travailler avec les départements pour animer et/ou suivre la démarche d’amélioration de la qualité : assurer la cohérence de bout en bout des reportings centraux et locaux, répondre aux besoins d’évolution, contribuer à assurer le respect dans les départements des règles édictées en central, et mener les actions nécessaires à l’industrialisation de l’ensemble du processus de production (extractions, entrepôt de données, planning, etc.).

Vous pourrez développer vos compétences :

Compréhension des projets d’ITGC et de leur structuration dans l’outil Clarity (méthodologie classique et agile, métrologie, suivi financier, sourcing, météos, etc.)
Utilisation des outils Dataiku et Tableau Software dans un contexte évolutif.

Les missions c’est important, l’équipe et l’environnement aussi !

Vous rejoindrez au sein d’ITGC (Fonction Informatique Group Central) de BNP Paribas (environ 4.500 personnes), l’équipe "Reporting & Data Quality" du Chief Operating Office.

Vous contribuerez aux travaux réalisés dans le cadre du pilotage central transverse des portefeuilles d’activités d’ITGC, enregistrées essentiellement dans l’outil Clarity.

L'équipe « Reporting & Data quality » est composée aujourd’hui de 6 personnes. Elle est au cœur du suivi et du pilotage transverse des activités d’ITGC.

Elle a pour mission de concevoir et produire les reportings de pilotage d’activité à destination du management d’ITGC et des départements (qualité des données, pilotage de l'activité et suivi de la consommation des budgets, météo des projets, etc.) et suivre les plans d'actions associés en liaison avec les départements.

Vous êtes installé dans nos locaux à Montreuil (93). Pour y accéder, plusieurs solutions sont offertes (ligne 1 jusque Saint Mandé, Ligne 9 jusque Porte de Montreuil, le Tram ou encore les bus 46, 98, 215 ...), le choix est vaste.

Notre monde change ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues. Notre monde change : notre manière de nous informer, de consommer… et de travailler aussi ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues.

description:
Why SoftwareOne?

About Goatpath

Goatpath is SoftwareONE’s software team that builds platforms and products to automate and govern customers’ software and cloud investments through intuitive products they love to use. We are humble, nimble, focused, always ready to do what’s right, not afraid to take the toughest and unmarked path – this is what Goatpath stands for. Within Goatpath there are currently four product groups: Marketplace, Cloud, Digital and Insights. Marketplace aims to redefine/revolutionize how software is bought, managed, and sold, while Cloud seeks to build the most simple and intelligent cloud management platform. Insights will allow customers to benchmark their maturity in the space of spend and technology, while Digital will revolutionize how customers will interact with SoftwareONE. All products are built on a shared platform.

The role

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer with experience in SQL, ETL pipelines and data warehousing. The ideal candidate should have a very strong ability in data modelling and be comfortable working with large and varied data sets. They should be able to create secure and flexible systems and model data for output through a variety of means including the use of report visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.

Responsibilities:

Design and develop data models for business intelligence and analytics
Build and maintain ETL pipelines and data warehousing solutions
Source, manage and integrate data from SQL and NoSQL databases, APIs, and other sources
Work with large and varied data sets, including structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data
Develop and maintain secure and flexible OLAP systems for analysis & self-serve reporting
Design and implement data visualizations and dashboards using tools like Power BI
Optimize data processing code for performance and reliability
Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to provide high-quality data for analysis and decision-making.
Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing data validation, cleansing and enrichment processes.

What We Need To See From You

Experience in data engineering/business intelligence development, with a proven track record of designing and implementing data pipelines and data storage solutions.
Advanced knowledge of Azure, including Databricks, Azure Data Factory and Azure SQL.
Familiarity with NoSQL technologies like MongoDB or CosmosDB.
Knowledge of data governance, data security, and regulatory compliance.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work independently and under tight deadlines.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python, R, or C# is a plus
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Being part of SoftwareONE means we live and breathe our company’s core values, most of all “Customer Focus” and “Speed”. But being part of the Goatpath team is a little more than that. Every single day we ask ourselves and our team members to:

Be curious, try things out! If you fail, that’s ok – we don’t blame
Embrace change and start with “why not?” instead of “why?”
Prioritize good over perfect – don’t withhold customers from functionality
Leave the ego and office politics at the door
Take ownership
….. and have fun!

Job Function

Goatpath

description:
Über die ropa GmbH

Der Glasfaserausbau bringt unterversorgten Regionen endlich bestes Internet – das ist als Telekommunikationsunternehmen unser tägliches Geschäft. Als ropa GmbHmit den Marken wisotel, echtschnell und DBN bauen und betreiben wir hochleistungsfähige Datennetze in vielen Regionen in Deutschland. Um unser rasantes Wachstum weiter voran treiben zu können, suchen wir Sie ab sofort in Vollzeit als Data Analyst (m/w/d).

Das zeichnet Sie aus

selbstständige und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise
ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
eigener Anspruch an Qualität, Sorgfalt und Detailtreue
ausgeprägtes Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Zuverlässigkeit
andauernde hohe Lernbereitschaft
Entscheidungswille, -stärke und notwendige Durchsetzungskraft
Sie möchten die erfolgreiche Entwicklung unseres Unternehmens aktiv mitgestalten und sich selbst dabei weiterentwickeln.

Aufgaben

So unterstützen Sie uns

Auswahl & Aufbau einer geeigneten DWH-Architektur & Datenstruktur sowie des BI Systems
Daten-Modellierung und Datenanalysen von abteilungsübergreifenden Unternehmensdaten
Erstellung von AdHoc-Analysen für Fachbereiche und Geschäftsführung
Entwicklung von Vorgaben zur Bereitstellung und Ermittlung von Daten für logische Datenmodelle und -strukturen
Mitarbeit in der Konzeption von Lösungen in einem crossfunktionalen Team
Finden von neuen Möglichkeiten vorhandene Daten in einem neuen Kontext zu nutzen und gleichzeitig das Fehlen nicht vorhandener Daten zu identifizieren
Entwicklung und Analyse von User Stories bzgl. Data Management / Data Architecture
Integration von neuen Datenquellen in das DWH, sowie Programmierung der entsprechenden ETL-Prozesse

Qualifikation

Das bringen Sie mit

abgeschlossenes Studium MINT Fach oder eine vergleichbare Berufsausbildung mit entsprechender Fachrichtung bzw. mehrjähriger Erfahrung im Umfeld Data Analytics
Berufserfahrung im DWH-Umfeld oder in ähnlicher Tätigkeit von Vorteil
Umfangreiche Erfahrung in der statistischen Analyse und statistischen Messungen
Erfahrung in der Analyse großer Datenmengen mit Tools wie R, Python, etc.
Erfahrung mit Datenbanken (SQL), und Datenmanagement
Vertrautheit mit Datenvisualisierungstools
sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
sicherer Umgang mit den gängigen MS-Office Anwendungen

Benefits

Darauf dürfen Sie sich bei der ropa freuen

Unsere Mitarbeiter sollen jeden Tag gerne zur Arbeit kommen und sich innerhalb des Teams und des Unternehmens gut aufgehoben fühlen. Diesen Anspruch stellen wir an uns selbst als Arbeitgeber. Um dem gerecht zu werden, bieten wir unseren Kollegen …

Einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag in einer zukunftssicheren Wachstumsbranche
Attraktive, Ihren Erfahrungen entsprechende Vergütung
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und gelebte Mobile Office Kultur
Abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeiten und selbständiges, eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten
Flache Hierarchien und schnelle Entscheidungswege
Verschiedene Aufstiegschancen und vielfältige, individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Ein hoch motiviertes, branchenerfahrenes, kollegiales Team mit viel Spaß an der Arbeit
Leckereien für die Pause und natürlich Wasser und Kaffee
Ein angenehmes Arbeitsklima durch familiäre Atmosphäre, Teamevents und unvergessliche Firmenevents

job_posting_title: Business Analyst Risque de Crédit F/H
description:
FinDiT Consulting est un cabinet de conseil spécialisé dans l'accompagnement des acteurs financiers dans la transformation digitale.

Notre offre s’articule autour de deux axes majeurs :

Le Conseil en accompagnement Digital, ou comment aider nos clients à converger vers des solutions digitales correspondant à leur métier (digitaliser un process de production de RFP, éliminer les frottements entre équipes legal/compliance/marketing lors de productions documentaires produits, etc….).
Et l’activité de prestation de consultants, avec une approche finance/IT sur les métiers de la MOA, chefferie de projet, applicatif, technico fonctionnel, Big Data.
Nos principaux clients sont des Grands Groupes bancaire, Asset Managers, Assurance, Brokers, Bourse ….

Pour accompagner notre croissance nous recherchons un(e) Consultant(e) Business Analyst Risque de Crédit.

Missions:

- Vous analyserez les différents besoins des différents acteurs en France et à l'international
- Vous spécifierez vos exigences aux développeurs de l'équipe.
- Vous testerez et suivrez la mise en production de vos évolutions.
- Vous serez en contact avec les métiers et vous serez amené à répondre aux questions des missions BCE.

Tout cela dans un environnement toujours évolutif répondant aux contraintes du régulateur (nouvelle règlementation CCR2, Bale 4).

Profil:
- Bac + 4 ou 5 (Ingénieur, MASTER)
- Une expérience au minimum 5 ans en tant que Business Analyst Risque de Crédit dans le secteur bancaire avec maitrise du Risque de Crédit, du reporting réglementaire, RWA, Bâle 4, SQL et de l'anglais.

Poste à pourvoir : ASAP
CDI ou Freelance
linkedin_skills: Credit Risk Management, English, Credit, Regulatory Reporting, Digital Technology, SQL, Risk Control, Basel III, and Banking

description:
RINA is currently recruiting for a Financial Analyst to join its office in Genoa, Italy within the Global Credit & Finance Division

Mission

Job Responsibilities

Monthly elaboration of Working Capital calculation and main relative KPIs both at Group and Business Units level
Execute Working Capital assessment, identify gaps with leading practices, define business case & operational recommendations to drive working capital benefits
Develop work plan and identify savings leveraging a driver-based approach and industry benchmarking data
Drive Working Capital transformation initiatives with a focus on value realization and capabilities development sustainability applying innovative combinations of strategy, governance, and organization & process redesign and technology alignment

Competencies

Building and Developing Professional/Technical Knowledge: Gain advanced knowledge of professional/technical area
Change, Innovation and Responsiveness: Implement changes
Communication and Influence: Communicate effectively and influence individuals
Customer/Client Service: Responsible for complex client requirements
Planning, Organising and Pro activity: Set medium to long term plans
Teamwork and Leadership: Team Player

Education

Master’s Degree in Economics

With over 4,000 employees and 200 offices in 70 countries worldwide, RINA is a multinational player which provides certification, marine classification, product testing, site supervision and vendor inspection, training and engineering consultancy services across a wide range of sectors. Our business model covers the full process of project development, from concept to completion. The aim is to guarantee a project’s technical, environmental and safety - and sometimes also economic and financial - sustainability.

At RINA, we endeavor to create a work environment where every single person is valued and encouraged to develop new ideas. We provide equal employment opportunities and are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels respected and safe from discrimination or harassment of any kind.

description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The Future Is What We Make It.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our Global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

By changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.

Make the Best You.

Working at Honeywell is not just about developing cool things. All our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Join us and Make an Impact.

We have an opportunity for a Finance Analyst to join our CORPteam in Bucharest.As Senior financial analyst you shall be a valuable business partner, ensuring value creation and support the PPE GBE.

Finance Analyst Responsibilities

Drive, review and back up for month close processes by ensuring the entity’s financial transactions are properly accounted for and correctly reported through HFM on a US GAAP basis, in accordance with Honeywell accounting policies.; f.e. monthly accruals, booking and reconciliation of sales between HSPE and Commissioner, allocation by LOB in HSPE and reconcile with COGS commissioner, timely preparation of Journal Vouchers, determine and submit I/C recharges, follow-up and drive resolution of any issues related to month close activities.
Partnership with Controllership and COTA to ensure operational efficiencies and transparency and timing of financial results.
Ensure accurate and Timely booking of I/C recharges in conjunction with controllership
Understand any balance sheet exposures and ensure inclusion in forecasts and outlooks
Calculate monthly accruals as required to ensure accurate financials
Owns and maintain the SOP (standard Operating Procedures) for the Country activities
Other accounting and finance duties where required; f.e. provide codding to AP team for external/I/C invoices, liaise with COTA / Controllership / Regional and global Finance Centre
Producing reports that enable continuous measurement and optimization of all key aspects of the business
Proactively identifying, communicating, and reporting P&L and balance sheet exposure mattersParticipate in the AOP/Forecast cycles
Partner with SBG Controllers to address in-country legal entity change management needs, including acquisitions, divestitures, site closures and core business processes migrations.
Qualifications

Bachelor Degree – Finance/Accounting, Business Administration and others
Fluent English writing & speaking skills required
Knowledge of SAP and Hyperion, use of Business Object
Advanced use of MS Office, especially Excel (but also Access)
We Offer

Medical plan
Budget for flexible benefit scheme which can be used for travel, sports, dental scheme, and others
Business Travel Accident Insurance
Voluntary defined contributory pension plan
Meal allowance
A culture that fosters inclusion, diversity and innovation
Market specific training and on-going personal development
If this is your dream role, then we'd love to hear from you.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Additional Information

Category: Finance
Location: 3 George Constantinescu,,Upground building, 5th floor (entrance A) District 2,Bucharest,BUCURESTI,020339,Romania

description:
Wer wir sind.
Das Kerngeschäft des Deutsche Rohstoff Konzerns ist die Gewinnung von Öl und Gas. Die Aktivitäten konzentrieren sich hierbei auf die USA, insbesondere auf die Bundesstaaten Colorado und Wyoming. Nördlich von Denver liegen derzeit die wichtigsten unserer produktiven Lizenzen. Wir sind seit Anfang 2011 in den USA erfolgreich.
Darüber hinaus beteiligt sich die Deutsche Rohstoff auch an Projekten rund um die Förderung von Batterie- bzw. Strategischen Metallen. Wir steuern als Muttergesellschaft alle Aktivitäten und initiieren neue Projekte.

Was erwartet Sie?

Sie übernehmen die Umsetzung des Financial Planning und des Financial Reporting für die Konzernholding mit dem Vorstand und führen betriebs- und finanzwirtschaftliche Bewertungen von Konzerninvestitionen durch (Financial Modelling)
Sie analysieren Märkte und führen Valuationen im Rohstoffbereich durch
Sie unterstützen den Aufbau der Finanzorganisation in Tochterunternehmen sowie die Entwicklung des Konzerns und der bestehenden Tochterfirmen
Sie helfen dem Finance-Team bei der Weiterentwicklung der KPI-Struktur sowie bei der Einführung und Verbesserung von Analyse- und Reporting-Tools, und helfen dem Finance- und Accounting-Team im
Sie denken und handeln unternehmerisch in einem noch wachsenden Unternehmen

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Flache Hierarchien und viel Verantwortung
Ein zentral gelegenes Büro mit Aufzug mit sehr guter Anbindung an den ÖPNV
Die Möglichkeit, im Home Office zu arbeiten
Klimatisierte Räume, eine ausgestattete Küche und kostenlose Getränke
Hervorragende Arbeitsatmosphäre in einem hoch motivierten und erfolgreichen Team

Was sollten Sie mitbringen?

Sie verfügen über ein überdurchschnittlich erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium und bringen idealerweise 2+ Jahre Erfahrung in den Bereichen M&A, Finance, Investments, Banking, Consulting mit
Sie besitzen ein hohes Maß an Selbständigkeit und Eigeninitiative, Proaktivität und Detailorientierung
Sie sind analytisch und sorgfältig mit einer hohen Affinität für Zahlen und einem zielorientierten Vertreten der Ergebnisse
Sie haben sehr gute Kenntnisse in Excel und Power Point (VBA-Kenntnisse von Vorteil)
Sie besitzen ein souveränes Auftreten sowie sehr gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten
Sie beherrschen Deutsch auf verhandlungssicherem Niveau, sowie fließende englische Sprachkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?

Truecaller transformed how we communicate when we launched in 2009 in Stockholm, Sweden.

Our mission is to build trust everywhere by making tomorrow's communication smarter, safer and more efficient. We focus on bringing smart services with big social impacts, like protecting people from fraud, harassment, and scam calls or messages. We identify new numbers from anywhere in the world and build a space for trustworthy conversations, for those that matter. Truecaller is loved by over 350 million people around the world and is growing very rapidly across regions.

Who we are:

The world's #1 caller ID and spam blocking service for Android and iOS.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities, spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, Tel Aviv and Nairobi.
Listed On Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap

We at the Cloud Telephony team,are on a mission to enable AI-powered communication solutions for consumers and businesses through the Truecaller platform. The team will focus on creating cutting-edge cloud telephony solutions for consumers. The features the team will develop will affect the experience of hundreds of millions of users around the world directly, and will improve their daily interaction with their phone.

As a Data Analystin the Cloud telephony team, you will build the dashboards which the team uses to analyze how the users are utilizing the Assistant feature.

What Do We Expect From You

4+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis (experience working for a Product oriented company is a plus)
Expertise in data visualization tools, such as Google Data Studio, Looker, QlikSens,Tableau, PowerBI, etc.
Experience using SQL to extract, transform and analyze data
Ability to communicate results of analyses in a clear and effective manner
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Good communication skills

What Will You Work On

Identify different sources and types of information from the different app stores, internal analytics, Campaign management tools, AB test solutions.
Collect, clean, organize, analyze and interpret application data and usage, draw insightful conclusions to enable data-driven product enhancements
Create visual interpretations of data on Data Studio or Looker, produce graphs and charts with insightful notes and summaries
Analyze customer data and assist product development in finding new innovative ways to optimize conversion and retention
Support the management in identifying, measuring and following up on key metrics
Analyze campaigns and user journey results in order to improve conversion and retention tactics
Provide regular, accurate and comprehensive statistical reports
Provide objective insight and analysis to influence decision making
Keep up to date knowledge on external market and data research to compare our metrics and create a value-added analysis

It would be great if you also have

Worked with Campaign management tools and metrics
Good understanding of A/B experiments and hands-on experience is a plus.
Good scripting and programming skills
Experience with Python and R programming language

Life at Truecaller -Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/

Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.

What we offer:

A smart, talented and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance and pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone that you fancy the most within our budget ranges.
Do it your way: For the days you're working from home, we provide you with an attractive budget for creating your cozy office at home.
Office life: Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, and have fun at our playroom! As well, exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, Geek lunch!

Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that's why we would love to meet you.

description:
Na Deloitte, oferecemos uma experiência profissional que inspira talentos como tu a transformar o mundo como o conhecemos, a torná-lo mais humano, eficiente e tecnológico. Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em tecnologia para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade, para desenvolverem soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação, de Portugal para o mundo.

És tu quem procuramos?

Formação superior nas áreas de Engenharia Informática, Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores ou similar
Anos de experiência: 2 a 5 anos em consultoria e em Business Intelligence/ Analytics
Conhecimentos sólidos em base de dados Oracle (incluindo arquitetura Exadata) e SQL Server
Conhecimentos técnicos em preparação e tratamento de dados (ETL): PL/SQL, SH, Powercenter, ODI
Conhecimentos técnicos em visualização de dados (Reporting & Self-service): Qlikview, Microstrategy, Power BI
Conhecimento da língua Inglesa no domínio falado e escrito
Autonomia, capacidade analítica e espírito crítico
Capacidade de comunicação e trabalho em equipa
Orientação para o cliente e para resultados
Comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal, trabalho em equipa e colaboração
Resolução de problemas, capacidade analítica e espírito crítico
Organização, planeamento e orientação para a qualidade dos projetos
Orientação para o cliente e para resultados

Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida

Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos
Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização
Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy)
Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud

Vive uma cultura de união

Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e percursores de tendências
Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade
Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas
Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, inovação, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.

Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte nunca trabalharás sozinho. Terás a oportunidade de integrar diversos projetos de transformação e fazer parte de uma equipa que te vai inspirar e ajudar a desenvolver soluções diferenciadoras, num ambiente dinâmico e colaborativo, onde podes dar o melhor de ti e beneficiar das nossas iniciativas de bem-estar e flexibilidade. Somos mais de 4000 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 1700 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa e no Porto, e de polos tecnológicos em Viseu, Setúbal e Leiria. Poderás integrar os nossos centros de excelência que demonstram a nossa liderança global em OutSystems (low code), engenharia de redes de telecomunicações, ServiceNow e Apptio (technology business management), Finastra (financial services industry), TIA e Guidewire (insurance industry). Se ambicionas aprofundar as tuas competências nestas áreas - software engineering, systems integration, data analytics, data science, cyber risk, technology solutions, network engineering, UX design - e gostas de trabalhar com tecnologias como AWS, Microsoft, Oracle, Salesforce, IBM, SAP, Feedzai, SAS, este é o teu lugar.

Keywords:Sobre a Deloitte; Technology; Consulting; Anos de Experiência

description:
Trustpair is reinventing B2B payment security.

We are building the leading anti-fraud solution for large corporations to help them avoid $20 billion in fraud every year.

With Trustpair, finance teams work with accurate data to avoid the risk of fraud and proceed to payments with peace of mind.

Trustpair is the best-in-breed product against B2B payment fraud and it must stay this way! Today a market-leader, Trustpair aggregates more data sources than its competitors and leverages on a bigger amount of payment data, making an intelligent use of the data collected.

Your role :

Integrated into the Data Team with 1 experienced Data Analyst, 1 experienced Data Engineer and a Data PM, reporting to our VP Operations, you will build and deliver a Data Analysis roadmap helping Trustpair’s management and teams take the best strategic and operational decisions.

You'll collaborate with all teams (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Operations, Product…) in the company to help them define and track their key performance indicators, as well as identify compelling insights to enhance operational and business performance.

In the long run, you will be a key contributor in fostering a data-driven culture and mindset across all Trustpair teams, and optimizing the use of internal data to improve the performance of our solution.

Your next challenges & main missions:

Design and deliver our data analysis roadmap

Work with management and internal teams to identify Business Intelligence priorities and design a clear company-wide Analytics roadmap
Roll out the roadmap by leading focused projects with various teams (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Operations, Product…), understanding their business needs, designing efficient data marts and delivering impactful visualisations (Looker) to help them take the best decisions

Foster a data-driven culture and empower business users

Make business, operations & product teams more autonomous by designing dedicated data marts, making data more accessible to them and training them to build self-serve data visualisations (Looker)
Support these teams on advanced business intelligence and exploratory analysis projects
Contribute to shaping Trustpair’s Data Team’s processes, organisation and tools, and rolling out data best practices

Why join Trustpair? A list of our perks here!

Required skills & experience:

2 years of Data Analyst experience, ideally in a startup/scaleup environment
Strong SQL skills and experience with BI / Visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, or similar)
Analytical, structured and result-oriented mindset
Ability to simultaneously manage several projects and collaborate/communicate with any type of stakeholder (Product & Engineering, Customer Success, Operations, etc.)
Dynamism and ability to adapt to new challenges
Knowledge of programming languages (Python), software engineering skills, familiarity with dbt and Looker are a plus

Recruitment Process:

Call with Aïcha, our Talent Partner (30 min)
Experience interview with Cyrille, VP Operations (1h)
Case study (should take around 2 hours of work on a 1 week timeframe) & restitution
Coffee fit & meet one of our co-founders

Equal Opportunity Statement

Trustpair's policy is to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category.

Applicants for all positions in Trustpair must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for or be a citizen from Schengen / EU zone. The verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.

description:

description:
Flatchr c'est: une Startup dans la RHTech qui a développé un logiciel de recrutement très innovant aidant les entreprises à trouver les meilleurs talents !

(On te montrera l'outil, promis)

C’est aussi une équipe survoltée qui a la "Poulpe attitude"!🐙

Le poste est rattaché à l'équipe Tech tu devras intéragir avec des devs, des P.O et des data Scientist.🖥️

Le pole Data est en formation chez Flatchr, tu participeras à sa création et son organisation accompagné(e) de notre CTO Damien

description:
Ref. 99459 – Financial Analyst (m/w/d)

NOTHING RUNS LIKE A DEERE!

Welcome to John Deere, the leading innovator of agricultural, forestry, construction, lawn and grounds care equipment supported by comprehensive parts and financial services solutions. With 79.225 employees worldwide, we develop and produce connected and technologically advanced machines with a total sale of $52,56 billion. By joining us you grow individually and become a key contributor in managing the biggest global challenge: supplying 8,03 billion people with food, clothing and infrastructure.

John Deere Walldorf GmbH & Co. KG serves as our Sales & Marketing competence center for Europe, North Africa, Middle East and CIS and counts about 400 employees who support our dealers to deliver the best possible service to our customers.

Our department Controlling is looking for a

Financial Analyst (m/w/d)

Our experienced controlling team optimizes financial processes, analyzes and interprets data to make substantiated business decisions. Through precise budgeting and risk management, we offer a valuable contribution to increasing the efficiency and sustainable financial performance of the company. Join our Controlling team and let's make the big leap forward!

What You’ll Get:

an attractive compensation package including variable pay program
competitive pension, holidays, life cover/income protection benefits
flexible working solutions to balance family and career
development and learning opportunities to support current needs and future aspirations

Your Responsibilities:

Contribute to the Financial Forecast and Product Line reporting preparation for the Walldorf entities (John Deere Walldorf GmbH & Co. KG and John Deere Walldorf International GmbH). This includes the branch business for the French, Spanish, German, International and Polish Agricultural markets
Act as business counselor for dedicated stakeholders in the Walldorf organization to support budget management and financial goals achievements
Collaborate with the Financial Shared Services for the month-end closing activities and internal control for the Walldorf entity
Support the projects impacting the Walldorf legal entity structure
Support the Financial Analysis Process for the European Branches to provide valuable Financial counseling to the European branches’ stakeholders
Be proactive in Financial process optimization for the European branches

What Skills You Need:

Successful completion of studies in finance, economy, business administration or similar
Significant experience in Financial reporting and Financial analysis.
Negotiation skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships
Commercial and business awareness. Knowledge of the branch business is a plus.
Ability to work in a diverse and international environment
Fluent in both English and German
Knowledge in US GAAP
Ability to stick to time constraints

This tariff position is based in Walldorf and vacant as soon as possible.

End of Posting:June/26/2023

No matter who you are - you are welcome at John Deere! We firmly believe that diversity and inclusion make us even stronger. If you can identify yourself with this - then we look forward to receiving your online application in English language!

John Deere Walldorf

Human Resources

Sophie Jardot

Additional Information:

To process applications, we use our online platform at our John Deere career page. We are not able to process applications through e-mail or post and ask for your understanding. Please complete the online application form, if you want to apply for a position at John Deere.

If you have any questions about your application, please contact: RecruitingGermany@JohnDeere.com .

description:
Cashpoint Malta Ltd.
We are one of the leading international sports betting providers and are a constantly expanding company in the entertainment industry.

We are the perfect team for you to join. We are constantly expanding and are involved in a fast-moving environment. We are open-minded and believe in open communication. We are anything but normal. And it’s been this way since 1996.

We are part of the Gauselmann Group, which offers high-quality entertainment to millions of people. Worldwide. Innovation, internationality and top-class technology – brought about by almost 15,000 dedicated people.

Play your part in the success of a dynamic, innovative company and join our CASHPOINT team!

We are looking for the next possible date at our site in St. Julians, Malta a

Performance Marketing Analyst (m/f/d)

CASHPOINT is one of the leading names in the sports betting industry and part of Gauselmann Group, an internationally recognised group of companies with almost 15 000 employees. We operate in multiple licenced markets, both online and with physical shops, and have ambitious plans for further expansion.
For this reason, we are looking for a Performance Marketing Analyst (m/f/d) to join our winning team at the earliest opportunity. You’ll be based in our Malta office, whilst working closely with colleagues in different countries. We are looking for someone who is passionate about the work and ready for the challenges that come in a busy marketing team within a fast-growing company.

Responsibilities:

As a Performance Marketing Analyst you will manage deliverability schedule and project timelines in the online marketing/data teams.
Further, you will develop expertise in gaming and sportsbook user behaviors and product gameplay.
Other tasks in this role involve performing on-going analytical support to the marketing department and assisting in the formation of econometrics through the use of regression analysis models.
Nevertheless, you will identify, analyze and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science or any related field
Minimum 2 years of experience in relevant data related business
Very good SQL skills essential, Python skills needed
Experience in web analytics (google analytics), Salesforce Marketing Cloud advantageous
Fluent English - a must, German advantageous, other languages also welcomed

What to expect:

Family-run group of companies with a positive and international business environment
Open door attitude and friendly corporate culture
High degree of personal responsibility
A wide variety of career opportunities within the entire group
Competitive salary and good benefits

Marton Krasz

description:
About Us

We are Quadcode, a company that develops a SaaS trading platform for clients around the world.
We are currently looking for an Antifraud Analystto join our Market Making department. As an Antifraud Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team's efforts to combat fraudulent activities.

Your responsibilities will include:

Fraud Analysis: Conducting technical, financial, and behavioral pattern analysis to identify potential fraudulent activities on the platform.
Monitoring Trading Activity: Proactively monitoring trading activity to detect any anomalies or adverse patterns that may indicate fraudulent behavior.
Anti-fraud Measures: Developing and implementing anti-fraud measures by creating effective anti-fraud rules and assessing their effectiveness in reducing fraudulent incidents.
Fraud Detection: Staying updated on new fraud mechanics and proposing innovative ideas to mitigate emerging fraudulent practices.
Internal Tool Improvement: Collaborating in the continuous improvement process of internal anti-fraud tools and mechanisms, contributing to enhancing their efficiency and effectiveness.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science, Finance, or a related discipline.
Previous experience in fraud analysis, risk management, or a similar role within the financial/gambling/gaming industry.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify patterns and anomalies in data
Knowledge of financial and technical aspects related to fraud analysis
Familiarity with statistical analysis techniques
Understanding of machine learning concepts and their application in fraud detection
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Effective communication skills to collaborate with team members and stakeholders
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with Python programming and data analysis libraries.
Familiarity with Jupyter Notebook for data exploration and analysis.

We offer

relocation opportunity to Cyprus after a trial period;
remote or hybrid work model in our Cyprus office;
health insurance and mental health services;
13th salary and 21 vacation days per year;
provided lunches or food allowance;
monthly tuition reimbursement (kindergartens/schools);
opportunity to learn English and Greek;
sports reimbursement;
team buildings and parties;
bonuses for special events (e.g. child's birth).

Note:All applications will be treated with strict confidence. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

description:
Positive Thinking Company ist Teil unseres weltweiten Ökosystems "Collaboration betters the world". Unsere 6 Gründungspartner Positive Thinking Company, Steep, Versett, Alispharm, Otofacto & OneAston helfen dabei das Unternehmenswachstum unserer Kund:innen durch Strategie, Technologie und Design zu verwirklichen.

Wir suchen dein Talent und deine Leidenschaft zur Verstärkung unserer Data & Analytics Expert:innen. Schließ dich uns an, entfalte Deine Fähigkeiten und Talente und stecke unsere Community mit Deiner Begeisterung und deinen Ideen an. Was uns wichtig ist? Die 3 W’s: Wissensaustausch, Weiterbildungen und Weiterentwicklung. Interessiert? Dann wird’s jetzt spannend

Aufgaben

Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für Kunden
Zusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisieren
Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung
Konsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen

Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.

Qualifikation

Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung
Ca. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics
Technologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder Yellowfin
Erfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von Vorteil
Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region

Benefits

Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: Unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.

Das erwartet Dich bei uns:

Onboarding: Du bist ab dem ersten Tag intern vernetzt: Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm
Entwicklung: Entwicklung ist bei uns individuell auf Deine Stärken ausgerichtet: Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online Trainingskatalog, Internationales Arbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Kulturen
Work-Life Balance: Raum für Deine persönliche Lebensplanung (Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, hochflexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg)
Nachhaltigkeit: Uns ist es wichtig, dass unsere Arbeit einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Menschheit hat. Dafür machen wir unsere Lösungen und unsere Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag ein Stückchen nachhaltiger.
Events: Fachlich und mit Spaßfaktor (Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern)
Netzwerken: Connecte Dich mit Deinen Kolleg:innen: Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions
Fehlerkultur: Mache Fehler und teste Dich aus: Wir geben Dir den Freiraum neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten
Prämien: Eine Vielzahl an Prämien für Dein zusätzliches Engagement
Weitere Vorteile: Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement

Kein:e Kandidat:in wird jede dieser gewünschten Anforderungen erfüllen. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen etwas anders aussehen und Du denkst Du kannst dieser Stelle einen anderen Mehrwert verleihen, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen!

Check unsere PTC Spotify Playlist aus und mache dir einen ersten musikalischen Eindruck von unserem Team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A

Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du dran - Wir freuen uns darauf Dich kennenzulernen!

description:
L'azienda:
GreenRouter è una start-up innovativa nata nel febbraio 2016 che si occupa di Green Logistics, avendo sviluppato una piattaforma per il calcolo dell’impronta climatica nella supply chain, che permette di gestire nel tempo i risultati aziendali, individuando e monitorando target di riduzione delle emissioni di CO2e.
Annoveriamo tra clienti importanti realtà nazionali e multinazionali, che riconoscono in noi un partner solido e affidabile. Siamo in crescita e alla ricerca di una figura professionale motivata, competente e dinamica da inserire nel team.

﻿La posizione:
Siamo alla ricerca di un/una green data analyst con propensione al project management, in ambito IT e logistico.
Il/la candidato/a svolgerà, insieme ai colleghi senior, attività di consulenza nel settore della Green Logistics presso il/i cliente/i seguendo progetti di implementazione del software GreenRouter.
Tra le mansioni richieste, il/la candidato/a si occuperà di comprendere la disponibilità dei dati, modellizzarli, redigere la necessaria documentazione di progetto, interagire con il cliente per identificare aree di miglioramento, supportare il team nella definizione di un’offerta di prodotto sempre più in linea con le aspettative del cliente.
Il/la candidato/a sarà inserito all’interno di un team di professionisti e sarà in grado di acquisire know-how in ambito “supply chain” e “green logistics”.

Caratteristiche richieste:
·Laurea Triennale o magistrale in discipline scientifico/quantitative (ingegneria, economia, ….).
·Forte motivazione e curiosità verso temi ‘green’, specie in ambito trasporti ed energia
·Esperienza di 2/3 anni in realtà strutturate del settore Energy/IT/logistica e/o presso importanti società di consulenza
·Esperienza con linguaggi Phyton e database SQL (costituirà titolo preferenziale conoscenza linguaggio PHP)
·Padronanza di Ms Excel e competenza nella gestione di dati complessi e destrutturati e nella loro modellizzazione
·Modalità di lavoro: ufficio, smart working, trasferte c/o clienti, team work
·Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese

description:
About us:

Pioneering trusted medical solutions to improve the lives we touch: Convatec is a global medical products and technologies company, focused on solutions for the management of chronic conditions, with leading positions in advanced wound care, ostomy care, continence and critical care, and infusion care. With around 10,000 colleagues, and a promise to be forever caring, our products and services are available in over 100 countries. Our solutions provide a range of benefits, from infection prevention and protection of at-risk skin, to improved patient outcomes and reduced care costs. The company is a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index (LSE: CTEC) and in 2021 revenues were over $2 billion. To learn more about Convatec, please visit http://www.convatecgroup.com

Overall purpose of the Role

The BI Developer Engineer is responsible to implement complex and specialized data solutions ensuring high quality on the delivery always looking for opportunities to improve and automate.

As a Developer Engineer, you will be working with business users, collecting their requests, and then updating the set of existing BI reports to accommodate business needs. You will also be expected to establish company standards and common reporting terminology, and to help align existing and future reporting requests to such standards.

Good communications skills are required to partner with business leaders across the company creating unique conditions to make you grow in the BI and Analytics ecosystems. This role should act as an transformation agent in Convatec.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, test, and deliver self-service infrastructure and BI content, including reports and dashboards, to business professionals using last generation ETL/ELT tools, reporting tools, and Dashboarding.
Design and build data management solutions focused on data acquisition, data quality, data transformation, migration planning, schema structures, and master data management.
Provide hands-on design and implementation expertise around data warehousing, ETL, OLAP/tabular cubes, report development and data modelling across the company.
Document and communicate processes and data structures to preserve institutional knowledge.
Ensure a high level of data integrity and work output with attention to detail, while meeting time sensitive goals.
Proven experience of interpretation and presentation of defined Business requirements supporting best practice and guidelines in delivering optimal operational quality.
Experience in showcasing full capability and functionality of Power BI to the End User community
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) and ability to demonstrate collaborative working with differing Teams across the IT landscape, including onshore and offshore.
Provide thought leadership, best practices, and standards required to deliver effective reporting and data visualization solutions to the various business units and executives.
Roll up sleeves and work hands-on with project teams to support objectives throughout delivery life cycle

Language Skills

English - Fluent
Portuguese (if not a native speaker)
Other languages can be a plus

What we are offering

Chance to move your career within the company that is the leader in delivering the pioneering trusted medical solution for the patients
Hybrid work model (1 day per week from the office in Lisbon)
Modern office space in the Lisbon city centre
Attractive compensation package with incentive plan and benefits
Great atmosphere across the team

Our progress will give you countless opportunities to move forward too. Seek out new challenges, and you’ll find them. Stretch your thinking, and you’ll find new ways to make an impact. And if you embrace the opportunity to drive your own growth, you could go further, and achieve more, than ever before.

This is a big step forward.

This is work that’ll move you.

Beware of scams online or from individuals claiming to represent Convatec

A formal recruitment process is required for all our opportunities prior to any offer of employment. This will include an interview confirmed by an official Convatec email address.

If you receive a suspicious approach over social media, text message, email or phone call about recruitment at Convatec, do not disclose any personal information or pay any fees whatsoever. If you’re unsure, please contact us at careers@Convatec.com.

Equal opportunities

Convatec provides equal employment opportunities for all current employees and applicants for employment. This policy means that no one will be discriminated against because of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, nationality, citizenship, ancestry, sex, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, genetic predisposing characteristics or any other basis prohibited by law.

Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives

Convatec is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Convatec employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written and signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Convatec. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.

Already a Convatec employee?

If you are an active employee at Convatec, please do not apply here. Go to the Career Worklet on your Workday home page and View "Convatec Internal Career Site - Find Jobs". Thank you!

description:
Poste

From the house of dream to the house of talents

« Quoi que vous fassiez - pour le travail ou le plaisir - faites-le avec passion ! Vivez avec passion... »*Christian Dior

Christian Dior fut le couturier du rêve. Dès la fondation de sa Maison en 1947, marquée par la révolution du New Look, il métamorphose ses songes en de merveilleuses créations. Son esprit visionnaire n’a eu de cesse de magnifier les femmes du monde entier, inspirant aujourd’hui et plus que jamais ses successeurs.« Le tissu est le seul véhicule de nos rêves (…). La mode, en somme, est issue d’un rêve, et le rêve, c’est une évasion »,écrivait-il dans son ouvrageJe suis couturier. Au fil de ses collections, Monsieur Dior est devenu le démiurge du bonheur de ses muses.

Aujourd’hui, riche de cet héritage d’exception et d’une communauté de plus de 7 500 talents, notre Maison incarne plus que jamais laMaison des Talentspensé par Christian Dior. Dans plus de 40 pays, nous faisons rayonner notre savoir-faire, notre audace et notre excellence à travers la passion et la créativité de nos collaborateurs. Rejoignez-nous et créez votre avenir dans notre univers généreux, disruptif et ambitieux où nous grandissons dans l’excellence, le courage et l’optimisme.

Le Petit Dictionnaire de la Mode
INFORMATIONS GENERALES

Département : Digital _ Team Data Intelligence

Tuteur :Christelle Llanes

Disponibilités pour Brief avec équipe Young Talent :Date

Contrat proposé :Stage ou Alternance

Durée de la mission :(1 à 2 ans en alternance)

Début souhaité de la mission :Début Octobre

Intitulé :Assistant Data Analyst

DETAIL DE LA MISSION

Contexte

Au sein de l’équipe Etudes Clients (siège Monde), vous assisterez l’équipe dans la production et l’analyse des données clients afin d’aider aux prises de décisions. Vous serez amené à être en contact avec nos interlocuteurs en zone ainsi que les divisions produites dans le but de les soutenir dans leur suivi client.

Descriptif

En fonction de votre profil, nous pourrons définir une mission principale : réalisation d’un score d’appétence produits, retravailler la segmentation clients actuelle, affiner la définition des clients inactifs pour mettre en place des traitements différenciés, …

En Périphérie De Cette Mission Principale, Vous Participerez à La Production Et à L’analyse Quotidiennes Des Données Clients

Réalisation d’études et d’analyses clients (analyse du comportement d’achat, profils clients, parcours clients, segmentations)
Gestion opérationnelle des campagnes marketing : recommandation de ciblage, comptages et créations
Mise en place de tableaux de bord afin de suivre la performance des campagnes (newsletters, mailing…)
Analyse des impacts des différentes actions clientèles monde (événements clients, …)
Profil

De formation Bac+5, type école d’ingénieur ou université spécialisée en statistiques

SAS / SQL indispensable
Rigueur, fiabilité et autonomie
Esprit d’équipe
Anglais indispensable
Ce que vous apprendrez au cours de ce stage :

Vous pourrez développer vos compétences analytiques (lecture de résultats, analyse et communication pertinente des enseignements).

Vous aurez également l’occasion de mettre en application vos compétences statistiques à l’aide notamment de SAS, dont vous pourrez de plus améliorer votre maîtrise.

Vous participerez à la vie courante d’un grand groupe de luxe, en découvrirez l’univers et les problématiques clients.

A titre personnel, vous développerez vos compétences relationnelles au contact des différentes équipes en zone et des divisions produit, ainsi que votre rigueur et votre autonomie.

Encourageant l’inclusion et la diversité sous toutes ses formes, Christian Dior Couture s'est engagé depuis 2013 dans une démarche en faveur de l'emploi des personnes en situation de handicap, et de la valorisation de toutes les singularités.

description:
Permanent TSB is one of Ireland's leading retail and SME banks, with an innovative range of products and services powered through an evolving digital landscape, our focus is centred on ensuring we deliver what our customers, colleagues and communities need to be successful.

As an Analyst - Analytics Platforms & Processes, your role is to design, implement and maintain analytics systems and processes that support Bank-wide solutions including the implementation of IRB, IFRS9, collection, acquisition & data models as well as regulatory process deployments such as LCR, FINREP & COREP. You will also be required to perform in-depth analysis into model and process outputs to ensure they have been deployed accurately and correctly, that model drivers are clearly understood and key trends are identified

Responsibilities:

Support the production of model and process outputs, including key metrics
Support the ongoing enhancement and changes required to the systems that perform these calculations
Assist in the development of new systems and processes to adhere to emerging legislation
Provide excellent service to process owners by delivering high quality outputs within agreed timelines
Produce high quality insights across all portfolios covering required regulatory and operational requirements, key performance indicators, risks and trends
Research new technologies and techniques to drive efficiencies
Work with colleagues across business functions on multiple projects to deliver changes and enhancements
Maintain and test the systems to provide first class service to all users of the system
Produce model and process documentation as required
Ensure compliance with Risk and Control framework

Requirements:

The role requires rigorous analysis of data and the use of advanced methodologies. Candidates should possess, at a minimum, a third-level honours degree in a numerate subject area such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Economics
Excellent IT skills with proficiency in all of MS Office suite
Proven ability to prioritise workloads and will show determination and flexibility to deliver to very challenging timeframes
Experience and knowledge of programming and databases
An ability to communicate complex issues in a straightforward manner
Excellent documentation, report writing & presentation skills
Positive attitude with an eagerness to learn

This is a Permanent role based in Permanent TSB's St Stephens Green.

Is this you?

Please apply online on our website or via the apply link of this role. Your application will be sent through to our Talent Acquisition team and they will be in touch regarding your application. We reserve the right to draw up a shortlist for interview. The Bank understands the importance of a consistent and relentless focus on championing diversity and inclusion. We aim to attract, recruit, and retain individuals with diverse backgrounds, skills, competencies and abilities to work collaboratively to enhance the service we provide to all of our customers and the communities we serve.

description:
SpotOn Connections offers international recruitment solutions and career consultancy for all industries across Europe. We deliver a premium service at all stages of the recruitment process, taking the time to get to know our clients and candidates on a personal level so that we can make the perfect match. Our network of consultants comes from a recruitment background, with particular specialization in the finance, legal, technical, and multilingual industries.

The Role

Your Responsibilities Will Include

Liaising with the CRM department to learn and improve reporting production, data analysis and create relevant insights.
Delivering brand and country analysis to support business decision-making.
Reporting on CRM Ad Hoc and Automated Campaigns KPIs and ROI.
Contributing with data analysis to provide CRM optimization strategies.
Monitoring performance and reporting on overall statistics of player life cycles.
Producing acquisition reports to measure business development efforts.
Working closely with the CRM team to ensure a thorough understanding of the business and player database journey flows and player behavior.
Analyzing VIP activity to improve retention rates and lifetime value.
Delivering ad hoc KPI reports as required by the business.
Proactively advising the relevant teams of appropriate actions based on data to drive customer value.

Ideal Profile

Skills Required

You have good numeric and statistical analysis skills are essential.
You are familiar with marketing and CRM to aid in understanding and delivery of business objectives.
You have a strong problem-solving mindset and a curious mind.
You have strong ownership and organization skills.
You have proficiency in Microsoft Excel (experience in professional data and reporting tools is considered a plus).
You are able to deliver actionable intelligence and insights to the relevant teams.
You have excellent communication and team working skills.

What's on Offer?

Career growth opportunities.
Work alongside & learn from best in class talent

job_posting_title: Business Analyst Junior en Asset Management H/F
description:
Après avoir intégré votre communauté CAPFI d'experts en gestion de projet où vous serez formé et coaché, vous interviendrez au sein d'une équipe client en tant que Business Analyst ou MOA.

Vos missions :

En parallèle, vous serez l'interlocuteur privilégié de l'équipe mobilisée sur le projet et vous assurerez le suivi humain et technique de chacun des consultants.

Dans un contexte d'évolutivité des activités, en tant que MOA/Business Analyst, vous serez intégré à une équipe d'experts en Asset Management chez l'un de nos clients. Vous accompagnerez l'équipe en place dans la maintenance évolutive et corrective des systèmes d'informations et dans la réalisation de différents projets transverses comme l'évolution des outils de tenue de position, de risque ou de gestion.

Au quotidien vous serez amené à travailler de façon transverse avec différentes directions et serez en charge de :

Collecter et analyser des besoins métiers,
Rédiger des spécifications détaillées,
Définir et exécuter des plans de tests,
Planifier et suivre la recette utilisateur pour garantir la qualité des améliorations livrées aux métiers,
Assurer le support fonctionnel de niveau 2-3,
Former des utilisateurs et rédiger des manuels de formation utilisateur,
Participer à la rédaction du dictionnaire de données,
Participer à l'amélioration continue des produits développés pour le client.

Vous êtes le bon candidat si :

Vous souhaitez vous challenger dans un environnement riche et exigeant,
Vous êtes curieux, organisé et passionné de finance et/ou d'IT,
Vous avez des connaissances techniques (SQL) et/ou fonctionnelles en finance de marché,
Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme d'école d'ingénieur, école de commerce ou équivalent,
Vous souhaitez évoluer dans des contextes rythmés par les cérémonies Agiles,
Vous avez une bonne aisance relationnelle et aimez travailler en équipe,
Vous souhaitez évoluer dans des environnements anglophones.

Ce que nous avons à vous offrir

CAPFI est une entreprise vivante qui place le collectif et le partage entre pairs au cœur de sa culture. Nous vous proposons un environnement de travail flexible dans l'organisation et agile dans le choix de vos missions. CAPFI c'est aussi :

Vous laisser libre de choisir votre manager ;
Vous offrir la possibilité de suivre des formations certifiantes ;
Vous permettre de rejoindre les Tribus et de faire vivre l'énergie collective et l'expertise de CAPFI ;
Vous permettre de consacrer un peu de votre temps pour aider les autres, via NQT, Emmaüs Connect et Le Congé Solidaire, des initiatives dont CAPFI est partenaire.

Chez CAPFI, nous mettons aussi un point d'honneur à ce que tous nos talents évoluent dans un environnement de travail sain, serein et respectueux des exigences sociétales et environnementales. C'est pourquoi :

Nous sommes labellisés B Corp ;
Nous sommes signataires de la charte sur l'équilibre vie professionnelle – vie personnelle et de la charte éthique CAPFI.

Chez CAPFI, nous aspirons à créer un environnement de travail engageant, respectueux, équitable et inclusif, où la valorisation de la singularité de chacun est une condition préalable au bien-être individuel et à la réussite collective. Dans notre processus d'entreprise vivante, nous sommes fiers d'être une entreprise garantissant et encourageant l'égalité des chances quel que soit le sexe, l'invalidité, l'origine, la couleur de peau, le statut marital, l'orientation sexuelle, la religion, l'âge, la citoyenneté, l'identité de genre.
