description:
At Lyreco we all share a common goal to strive for passion, excellence, respect and agility. We are proud to be the European leader and the third largest distributor of workplace products and services in the world

We are committed to the development of our employees and we aim to achieve that by creating a culture that inspires and empowers.

Are you seeking a new challenge? This offer might be for you!

Net zoals de maatschappij, evolueert ook ons bedrijf heel snel. Daarbij spelen data natuurlijk een belangrijke rol. Zowel interne data als externe data. Belangrijke projecten zijn gebaseerd op de inzichten die deze data opleveren. Om die inzichten te verwerven en data projecten te coördineren, hebben we jou nodig.

Je bent zeer sterk in het omgaan met data, vindt er plezier in om het verhaal eruit naar boven te halen, en bent in staat dit verhaal te vertellen aan je collega’s uit verschillende departementen.

Je werkt gestructureerd en kan de nodige prioriteiten stellen gebaseerd op de strategische doeleinden en in overleg met stakeholders. Hoe ziet je dag eruit?

Management van segmentatie data

Data collectie, - validatie en - onderhoud
Verrijking van onze interne data
Management van prospect data uit externe bronnen

Koppeling aan onze interne data
Systeem uitzetten om dit inzichtelijk te maken.
Analyse

Vanuit de behoeften van je gesprekspartners de juiste data verzamelen, aan elkaar verbinden en van daaruit het juiste verhaal naar boven brengen
KPI’s opstellen in samenwerking met mensen uit verschillende departementen
Deze KPI’s opvolgen in een heldere rapportering
Geografische analyses uitvoeren
Projectwerking

Datagestuurd meedenken in projecten binnen de lokale en de internationale organisatie.
Proactief de organisatie voorzien van data-gedreven opportuniteiten

Bruikbare modellen en predicties opstellen en delen binnen de organisatie

Wie zoeken we?

Je bent analytisch en kritisch, en je houdt van een intellectuele uitdaging.
Je bent nieuwsgierig, nauwkeurig en stressbestendig.
Je hebt veel ervaring met data analyse.
Je bent sterk in Excel en VBA.
Ervaring met programmeren (SQL, R Studio, Python,…) is een vereiste.
Ervaring met een visualisatietool (Power BI, tableau,…) is een vereiste.
Ervaring met predictive modelling is een pluspunt.
Ervaring met database management is een pluspunt.
Je staat open voor nieuwe tools en omgevingen.
Je kan goed communiceren en schrikt niet van overleg met mensen uit andere departementen en/of landen.
Je houdt van projectmatig werk.
Je bent bereid te werken in een matrix omgeving.
Je kan je goed uitdrukken in Nederlands en Engels. Frans is een pluspunt.

Wat bieden we?

Een voltijdse en afwisselende job in een goed georganiseerd en gestructureerd internationaal bedrijf
Uitstekend marktconform salaris
Een bedrijfswagen en tankkaart, smartphone en tablet of laptop
Extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques en een hospitalisatieverzekering
20 vakantiedagen + 6 extralegale verlofdagen (o.b.v. 38-urige werkweek)
Een ruim opleidingspakket om jou als lid van de Lyreco familie verder te ontwikkelen
linkedin_skills: Key Performance Indicators, Data Analytics, Data Visualization, Problem Solving, Data Science, Analytical Skills, Statistics, and Data Modeling

job_posting_title: Data analist Bij Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland
description:
Data analist

Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland

Delft, 36 uur, salaris minimaal € 3736 - maximaal € 5092 Als data analist ben je een echte specialist op het gebied van data-analyse en het gebruik van tools met de focus op PowerBI. Door jouw kennis in te zetten in ons team groeien wij naar een betere samenwerkingspartner in de organisatie. Ben jij die data enthousiasteling die wil meebouwen aan het team Datagedreven Werken? Dan komen wij graag met jou in contact!

Wat ga je doen?

Vanuit de hele organisatie komen datavraagstukken. Jij pakt die met het team op en speelt een actieve rol bij het verduidelijken van het vraagstuk en het beoordelen van de haalbaarheid ervan. Samen met de data engineer ga je aan de slag met de databronnen en zorgt dat data op een juiste manier gebruikt kan worden. Je maakt een mooi dashboard met behulp van PowerBI (DAX) en Azure (SQL) waarmee je een organisatieonderdeel inzichten biedt, die niet meer handmatig gegenereerd hoeven te worden. Ook bied jij de organisatie de mogelijkheid zelf rapporten te maken. Tenslotte zorg jij dat de datastromen en de rapportagetool op een goede manier beheerd worden. Verder hou je je bezig met het:

Opstellen van aanpak om data te verkrijgen over of ter ondersteuning van bedrijfsprocessen;
Verwerken van de verkregen data, deze omzetten tot begrijpbare informatie en hierover advies geven;
Opstellen van automatische rapportages;
Creëren van datamodellen en visualisaties;
Het ondersteunen van self service analytics;
Beheren van datastromen en rapportages.

Meer weten? Bel of mail Anna!

Voor vragen over de procedure kun je contact opnemen met:

Anna Zanstra Corporate recruiter en adviseurazanstra@hhdelfland.nl06-46885095

Wat bieden we jou?

Deze functie is ingedeeld in schaal 10 van de CAO Werken voor Waterschappen en kent een minimum van € 3.736,- en een maximum van € 5.092,-bruto per maand. Doorgroeien naar een senior positie in schaal 11 (een minimum van € 4.149,- en een maximum van € 5.742,-) behoort tot de mogelijkheden.
Een aanstelling van een jaar, met intentie tot een vast dienstverband.
Het betreft een fulltime functie van 36 uur per week (1,0 fte).
Afwisselend werken op onze prachtige locatie in hartje Delft en vanuit huis.
Een Individueel KeuzeBudget (IKB) ter waarde van 21% van het salaris. Dit budget geeft jou de vrijheid om zelf te beslissen of je extra verlof wil kopen, een studie wil financieren of bijvoorbeeld je basissalaris maandelijks wil aanvullen.
Wij stellen € 6000,- beschikbaar voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling, dit noemen wij ‘Persoonsgebonden Basis Budget’, waar het om gaat is dat wij jou stimuleren jezelf te ontwikkelen.
Je krijgt een NS-businesscard of als je niet met het OV reist, dan krijg je netto € 0,21 per km. Je kan ook tegen gunstige voorwaarden een fiets aanschaffen voor je woon-werkverkeer.
Delfland biedt een mooie aanvulling op de wettelijke ouderschapsverlofregeling
Samen met Fello bieden wij mantelzorgondersteuning. We vinden het namelijk belangrijk dat werkende mantelzorgers ondersteund worden.

Wat maakt jou succesvol?

Je bent klantgericht en communicatief vaardig zodat je optimaal kan bijdragen aan de gezamenlijke doelen van Delfland. Hierbij kan je zowel goed zelfstandig werken als in teamverband. Je werkt nauwkeurig en je kan plannen, rapportages en informatie helder verwoorden.Behalve deze vaardigheden heb jij naast aantoonbaar hbo werk- en denkniveau ook:

Minimaal zes maanden werkervaring met Azure of een vergelijkbare clouddienst.
Minimaal twee jaar werkervaring met PowerBI of een vergelijkbare applicatie.Verder maken een proactieve werkhouding en gevoel voor humor jouw profiel compleet!

Waar kom je te werken?

De afdeling IMG is verantwoordelijk voor de informatievoorziening van Delfland. Zo’n 40 bevlogen professionals houden zich bezig met thema’s als architectuur, functioneel beheer, gegevensbeheer, GEO-informatie en GIS, business analytics, documentbeheer, archivering en data-gedreven werken. Er heerst een informele en open werksfeer waar op vaste dagen afwisselend op kantoor en vanuit huis wordt samengewerkt.Het Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland heeft een belangrijke maatschappelijke taak: wij zorgen voor droge voeten en schoon water in een dichtbevolkt en intensief gebruikt stukje Nederland. En hoewel Delfland ruim 730 jaar bestaan, zijn we allesbehalve ouderwets. We besteden veel aandacht aan belangrijke maatschappelijke thema’s zoals klimaatadaptatie, duurzaamheid, circulariteit en inclusiviteit. Geworteld in het verleden werken we zo, samen met verschillende partijen, aan een mooie toekomst voor ons gebied en onze inwoners!

Onze drive

Onze ambitie is groot maar onze drive om samen te werken naar een schone en veilige leefomgeving is nog groter!

Sollicitatieproces

illustratie Eerste gesprek Tweede gesprek Optioneel klikgesprek Arbeidsvoorwaarden- gesprek en aanbod Je hebt de baan!

Interessante baan?

Contact

Stuur dan jouw motivatie en CV uiterlijk 18 juni via de link. De 1e gespreksronde staat gepland op dinsdag 27 juni as, de 2e gespreksronde op vrijdag 30 juni as. We vragen je daar alvast rekening mee te houden.Voor vragen over de functie kun je contact opnemen met Robin van den Assem (06-31645005, Product Owner team Datagedreven Werken). Voor vragen over de procedure kun je contact opnemen met Anna Zanstra, recruiter (06-48665095).
linkedin_skills: Data Visualization, DAX, Dashboards, Self Service, Microsoft Azure, SQL, Analytics, Statistics, Microsoft Power BI, and Query Languages

description:
Who are we?

At Vertiv, we build products that keep critical technologies running 24/7. We are proud we were the first to protect mainframes with precision cooling systems. We were the first to introduce an integrated enclosure system to distributed networks. We help some of the largest names in the industry bring new capacity online faster and at a lower cost when search and social media increased demand for storage and computing. Our portfolio spans power, thermal and infrastructure management products, software and solutions, and is complemented by a network of nearly 250 service centers worldwide.

We are now looking for a Junior Data Analystto join our team in Cluj-Napoca, Romania.

Summary

Vertiv Service business is designed to provide full life-cycle service support for our customers and as such is a core part of the Vertiv market offering. On site activity is a crucial element of Vertiv Service organization around the world. Vertiv CE are doing hundreds of thousands visits every year to maintain the critical infrastructures devices supporting Vertiv Customer applications.

As Junior Data Analystyou will within Big Data team to deliver meaningful output for use by the business and its customers. This could be different type reports like performance (equipment, site, operational) analysis, statistical (bench marking, operational, site, customer) analysis, maintenance planning, cost analysis for service contracts, etc.

In this role, you will be working directly with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, cross functional teams across various teams, both at a Regional and Global level, as well as Technology, Data, Insights & Analytics teams.

Reporting relationship:

This position will report directly to Big Data Team Leader, who reports to Global Service Platforms organization.

Essential role functions:

Interpret the data, analyses results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports that will convert into business opportunities.
Work with Management Systems leaders (Product Management and Marketing) and with the experts in the different technologies to priorities business and information needs.
Actively work with the Center of Expertise leaders (Thermal, AC and DC power, Batteries, Generators) to identify the needs for data collection at system, site and network level.
Collect feedback from Technical experts to improve the reports and data collection and verify that the improvements suggested have achieved the expected results.

Additional responsibilities might be assigned:

Define, with the subject matter and product specialists, the data to collect from the systems and site process sold and utilized by Vertiv.
Define strategies to optimize statistics in terms of efficiency and quality, including filter and clean data defining KPI's to identify problems at data base level.
Collaborate with the Monitoring solution architects to assure the efficiency of the data collection in different projects and solutions.
Work with the Global and regional teams to design, develop and maintain the Service Analytics concept. Develop and maintain the Global Data Lake used in conjunction with the Analytics Service organization plus other requirements as needed by the company.

Minimum qualifications:

Degree in Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field.
Working experience for minimum 1-2 years as a data analyst or business data analyst preferably oriented to IoT and M2M environments.
Technical knowledge regarding data (models, mining, cleansing, segmentation) and database design techniques.
Good knowledge and experience with BI reporting packages (Power BI, Tableau, etc), databases (SQL, etc), programming (Python, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks).
Modeling skills to represent requirements information in graphical forms that augment text representations.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyses, and disseminate significant amounts of information from different technical environments.
Knowledge and capability to understand specific applications in the Data Center, Telecom, Industrial and Edge segments.
Strong Communication skills and be able to pick new technology as we expand our data analytics footprint
Ability to ideate and be able to pursue those ideas to deliver business value

Language skills: English - Advanced/native level; Any additional major foreign language is a plus.

Travel Required: approximately 10% to visit real installations and Vertiv Center of Expertise

Location:Rumania - Normal office environment and schedule. Geographically distributed (virtual) team.

Are Youthe one we are looking for? Perfect! Apply directly to this job ad and take the first step towards a career with Vertiv!
linkedin_skills: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, Computer Science, Data Collection, Communication, Data Architecture, Analytics, Key Performance Indicators, Databases, and Thermal Desktop

description:
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?

Do you love digging into data to find insights and solve problems?

Are you excited to work in a fast-paced global environment?

Do you thrive in an open, positive, and dynamic culture built on competence and trust?

If you answered yes to the above, then the Finance Analyst role may be a good fit for you.

As a finance analyst at VMware, you’ll be part of a global team that provides the visibility, reporting and insight for data driven decision making. You will get hands-on experience presenting financial results to business partners, managing operational expenses, tracking metrics, implementing process improvements, and researching drivers impacting future investments. You will get opportunities to innovate, build your own models, grow your role and become a trusted finance advisor.

Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?

Forecast and analyze headcount (HC) and OPEX spend for assigned organizational unit:

Within 30 days of employment, become competent with VMware’s FP&A processes, fiscal calendar, and main tools.
Within 90 days you would be independently updating HC and OPEX forecast for assigned organization based on latest available information and would be executing on period close activities as per applicable timelines
Within 180 days you would be in position to maintain and distribute regular reporting packages and analyze variances to forecast; be able to provide commentary and additional context to business partners and address other ad hoc requests they might have
Within 360 days you would be ready to review and challenge HC and OPEX investment requests received from the business as well as assist in developing new financial models supporting long term planning and scenario evaluation
You would be collaborating with other colleagues from Finance, Accounting, Procurement, Operations and Sales to improve existing reporting and build new dashboards as requirements evolve

The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?

The primary goal of this role is to support the business with all the aspects of HC and OPEX financial management. Your regular activities may be modified to suit your professional strengths, but you can expect a variety of the following assignments:

Prepare and input in Hyperion OPEX and HC forecast as per FP&A calendar; discuss main assumptions, risks, and opportunities with business and central sales finance
Review spend and make variance analysis using SAP BI, general ledger and other available data sources
Complete close tasks as per quarterly schedule
Review and approve Purchase and Personnel Requisitions; make sure approved spend is as per budget, drives savings or has reasonable ROI
Update excel dashboards and power point decks required as per the regular reporting schedule
Maintain and start building financial models for evaluating existing and up-coming investment initiatives
Manage queries and reporting requests from the various stakeholders

What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?

You would be joining the 50+ Sofia Finance Team. The global team is spread across the VMware offices including Palo Alto, Cork, Bangalore and Heredia.

We are a community that supports each other and strives to provide psychological safety. Our team culture is one based on trust, having pride in one’s work, continuous improvement and adaptivity.

Where is this role located?

Flexible: The location of this role is flexible within Sofia region. Work will be done from an office some days during a week and other days from a non-VMware building.

What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?

VMware offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package for you and your loved ones. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.

Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long-term incentives
Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and beverage program, open communication
Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation
40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)
Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes

Category :Finance

Subcategory:Finance

Experience:Manager and Professional

Full Time/ Part Time:Full Time

Posted Date:2023-03-30

VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

description:
Functieomschrijving

For our client, a pharmaceutical company in Zwijnaarde, we are looking for a QC Analyst. Your tasks and responsabilities include:

Responsible for the completion of QC testing related to the manufacturing of autologous CART products for clinical trials and commercial operation in a controlled cGMP cleanroom environment.
Ensure testing is completed in compliance with all applicable procedures, standards and GMP regulations.
Work with Process Development team, Quality and Operations organization to successfully transfer process/analytical testing to cGMP facility to manufacture products.
Conduct analytical testing of raw material/utility, in-process, or final product samples submitted to the QC laboratories.
Perform peer review/approval of laboratory data.
Utilize electronic systems (LIMS) for execution and documentation of testing.
Create, review and approve relevant QC documents, SOP’s and WI’s.
Perform tasks in a manner consistent with the safety policies, quality systems and cGMP requirements.
Other duties will be assigned, as necessary
Profiel

Education:
A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Engineering or equivalent technical

discipline is required or relevant years of experience within the pharmaceutical

industry.

Experience:
A minimum of 1-2 years relevant work experience is required. It is preferable that

the candidate have experience working in an aseptic manufacturing facility,

preferably in quality assurance, manufacturing compliance, clinical quality, or cell

therapy.

Aanbod

You will end up in the fascinating world of biotechnology in a strong and respectful, diverse team in which everyone is welcome.
You will receive an attractive salary and a permanent position.
You will work with a diverse team that speaks English and Dutch.
The first year you will work in a dayshift. In 2024 you will work in a 2 shift regime.
Training on the job
Bedrijfsinfo

Our client is a global biotechnology company dedicated to the treatment and cure of life-threatening diseases. They are in full expansion and are looking for motivated and committed employees. As an employee at the company, you make a daily difference in the lives of many patients who suffer from cancer and other life-threatening diseases.

job_posting_title: Stage - Business Insight Analyst - Études marketing H/F
description:
Rouen

Ferrero est une entreprise familiale dotée d’une approche progressiste et mondiale, représentée par des marques emblématiques telles que Nutella®, Tic Tac®, Ferrero Rocher®, Raffaello®, Kinder Bueno® et Kinder Surprise®. À mesure que notre passion envers nos marques va croissant, il en va de même pour notre portée internationale qui pousse sans cesse ses frontières toujours plus loin. Le Groupe Ferrero est présent dans 55 pays et ses produits sont vendus dans plus de 170. Les générations du monde entier nous portent dans leur cœur. Quel est donc le secret de notre réussite internationale ?

Nous devons notre succès au dévouement de près de 35.000 employés pour lesquels il est sacré d’accorder toute leur attention et d’assurer la qualité nécessaires à l’existence d’une entreprise, à la poursuite de carrières et à l’élaboration de marques dont nous sommes fiers. Vous pourriez devenir l’un d’entre eux, n’hésitez pas à nous rejoindre.

Ferrero s'engage à établir une culture diversifiée et inclusive dans laquelle tous les employés se sentiront accueillis et appréciés et disposeront des mêmes opportunités. Nous sommes convaincus du talent de tous nos collaborateurs. En encourageant la curiosité et les capacités naturelles de nos employés, nous mettons à leur disposition, génération après génération, les moyens de réussir de façon personnelle et professionnelle, leur permettant de façonner leur carrière chez Ferrero. La diversité de nos talents est ce qui rend notre environnement de travail multiculturel, innovant et très enrichissant.

Principales responsabilités :

Vous aurez la charge de la mise en œuvre et suivi des études

Analyse et suivi des performances des marques de notre portefeuille et de leurs concurrents

Analyse des panels distributeurs et consommateurs en garantissant leur qualité et leur fiabilité

Accompagnement des équipes dans la mise en place des études panels et shopper

Vous serez le contact privilégié avec les équipes Trade Marketing, Marketing et Commerciale

Relais avec les instituts d’études

Répondre aux demandes ponctuelles de nos clients internes en fonction de l’actualité des marques

Votre Profil :

Bac +4/5 Ecole de Commerce/Ingénieur/Agroalimentaire/Université, vous avez une affinité avec la grande consommation et une sensibilité aux problématiques Marketing et Trade Marketing

Organisation, rigueur, esprit de synthèse, bon relationnel, réactivité

Goût pour les chiffres, esprit d'analyse, curiosité

Idéalement : Maitrise des panels NIELSEN et/ou KANTAR

Lieu: Rouen (siège social à Mont-Saint-Aignan)

Période: 6 mois, à partir de Janvier ou Juillet

Gratification: 904€ bruts/mois (licence) /1 356€ bruts/mois (M1 et M2)

Avantages: Remboursement 50% transports en commun + restaurant d'entreprise/tickets restaurant + 5 jours de congés payés

Si vous faites partie de la TEAM Ferrero, vous aurez la chance de découvrir la cité Rouennaise et la merveilleuse terre de Normandie lors de votre temps libre. Située à moins de deux heures de Paris et moins d’une heure de la mer, Rouen et sa vallée de Seine sont un havre de paix pour qui y vit. Avec ses nombreux monuments, sa cathédrale la plus haute de France, son patrimoine culturel, sa gastronomie, ses produits du terroir à déguster dans ses nombreux restaurants et bars, et son emplacement central, Rouen ne peut qu’être capitale de la Normandie ! Ici, vous aurez l’occasion de traverser des paysages variés et pourrez alterner entre ville et campagne tout en vivant dans une ville étudiante pleine de dynamisme.

Ferrero s'engage à déployer une culture de la diversité et de l’inclusion, grâce à laquelle tous les collaborateurs se sentiront accueillis, appréciés et disposeront des mêmes opportunités. Nous sommes convaincus du talent de chacun de nos collaborateurs. En encourageant leurs curiosité et capacités naturelles, nous leur permettons de se développer personnellement et professionnellement, et de grandir chez Ferrero. La diversité de nos talents est ce qui rend notre environnement de travail multiculturel, innovant et très enrichissant.

Cette année encore, Ferrero décroche la labellisation HappyIndex® / Trainees 2022 France ! Rejoignez-nous !

description:
L-Stone Capital, launched in October 2022 and based in Athens, Greece, is a seed / seed+ venture capital firm.

We invest in companies that are looking to take advantage of the monumental changes in the post Covid-19 world and the 4th Industrial Revolution.

L-Stone Capital provides financing and support high-quality and ambitious Management teams in growing their start-ups into scalable international businesses.

Having completed our first investments, we are looking to strengthen the team with an Analyst / Associate.

This is a dual investing / operational role providing an excellent career path for a highly motivated individual within a highly ambitious and growing platform.

The role represents the opportunity to join an open and flat team culture where everyone is encouraged to contribute to all investment discussions.

Key Responsibilities:

Assisting in sourcing & evaluating potential investment ideas – you will be part of the full investment process from origination to exit

Investment screening
Investment report writing
Due-diligence and market research
Financial modelling
Portfolio monitoring & active interaction with portfolio companies

Assisting in LP reporting

Preparation of presentations
Assisting in LP reporting

Leading operational tasks

Ongoing communication with external parties (e.g. custodian, lawyers, auditors, advisors etc.)
Assisting in fund structuring, auditing, valuation, tax management etc.
Assisting in preparation of fund calculations, IRR returns etc.
Management of capital calls, wire payments, distributions, etc.
Monitoring and review of fund expenses
Managing website and LinkedIn etc (posting new investment, portfolio updates etc.)

Experience & Skills:

Excellent educational background from a top academic institution
Minimum 2 years of work experience (management consulting, investment banking, engineering and start-ups could be a relevant background; however, given the highly dynamic nature of venture capital, exceptional candidates from a wide spectrum of work experience can be considered)
Ambitious & driven
Entrepreneurial - seeing and taking opportunities
Commercial and highly analytical mindset with: (i) strong analytical skills and ability to evaluate risks & opportunities (ii) ability to research & analyse businesses from an industrial and strategic point of view, not only financial, (iii) enthusiasm to create and own a network of key stakeholders
Excellent communication skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to prioritise & work independently
Fluency in English

description:
Job Description

Career Family, Level & Title: Senior Professional

Job Type: Permanent

Closing Date: 24 February 2023

Who are we?

We want to be the best place that any of our colleagues have ever worked.

At Standard Life International, we believe everyone should have a future to look forward to, and that means looking after our customers, our shareholders, and our people. Standard Life succeeds because of our people – our skills, passions and experience. We will help you grow and progress by acknowledging your talent and rewarding you fairly. In return, you’ll give us your energy, enthusiasm and the drive to deliver results.

We are a part of the Phoenix Group. Phoenix Group are the UK’s largest long-term savings and retirement business with c.13 million customers and c.£300 billion of assets under administration. As a market leader and FTSE100 organisation, we understand that our scale and expertise means that we have a key role to play for our customers, colleagues and our communities to help as many people as possible secure a life of possibilities. We are tackling key environmental and social issues such as transitioning our portfolio to net zero by 2050 – but we’re not done yet.

We’ve seen huge growth and change, and this means there is enormous opportunity for our 7,000 colleagues to grow alongside us.

Flexible working

You can expect to work in a hybrid manner with time spent working in the office and at home. We believe that work/life balance offers benefits for customers as well as ensuring that you can balance a successful career with your life outside of work. We will discuss flexibility, what is important to you and balancing this with business requirements during the recruitment process.

Role Context

We currently have an opportunity within the Calculations Team. Working within a small team, the role reports directly to the team manager and will involve interaction with senior colleagues across the Irish branch as well as colleagues based in UK. The Calculations team sits within the Operations function in the Irish branch.

Role Purpose

Within Standard Life Ireland, the Calculations Team is responsible for supporting system development by producing calculation specifications in initial design stage of projects and following through with testing these developments.

In addition, the team supports the business when system failure occurs. This can range from producing statements that have failed, to analysing and remediating system calculation errors, calculating policy values and ensuring our quotations and statements are correct and comply with regulations.

The successful candidate must be highly numerate with an ability to understand and use formulae in Excel, have an analytical mind, logical decision making abilities, strong problem solving skills, be an excellent communicator and must enjoy working as part of a team. Knowledge of Standard Life’s products and systems, and an ability to demonstrate working in an analytical environment will be advantageous.

Key Roles And Responsibilities

Represent the team as subject matter expert on a wide range of projects
Produce calculation specifications when required
Test calculation development to ensure that systems are working as intended
Calculate values and/or produce adhoc/annual statements for policies when our systems fail
Maintain and develop calculation spread sheets that are used by the team and in other areas of the business
Act as document owner for documents owned by the team
Investigate and remediate calculation issues as and when they arise
Perform monthly processes
Assist with complaint handling
Production of With Profits Investment Report and PRSA Schedules
Maintain a working knowledge of the legislation and regulations appropriate to the role

Required Skills

Numerical Honours Degree Qualified is desirable but not essential
Experience in the Financial Services
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Highly numerate with an ability to understand, use and create complex formulae
Attention to detail
Keen business sense and an ability to simplify complex details
Strong customer focus
Ability to work alone and cross functionally and able to adapt and react to continuous demand changes
Performance driven individual and self-motivated
Excellent communication, particularly of technical concepts with the ability to make the complex simple (verbal and written)
Provide technical support and coaching to less experienced analysts in area of expertise.
Balancing competing priorities on different pieces of work.
Influencing decision across SL project teams where priorities and interests are often conflicting.
Will escalate issues that have a high impact to the appropriate manager using the established governance frameworks.
Authorised to produce non standard quotes, provide information on technical area of expertise to internal and external customers, but cannot give advice.

What We Offer

Bring your ‘whole self’, skills and dedication to the Phoenix Group and we’ll recognise your effort, support your development and help to drive your ambition. We’ll ensure you’re rewarded for your contribution with a competitive package that includes an attractive pension, annual bonus potential, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlement, enhanced maternity and adoption leave and a range of other financial services and lifestyle flexible benefits.

Join us and you join a unique organisation. It’s not just the 14 million policyholders we serve, or the £300 billion of assets we look after. Or that we’re a FTSE 100 company that has been listed as one of the UK's Top Employers for nine years running. It’s our talented, inclusive and diverse workforce that makes us a success. We offerflexible workingopportunities ensuring we attract and retain the very best of talent. Find out about more about our people’sstories, ourvaluesand our commitment todiversity.

We value diversity in our workforce and welcome enquiries from everyone.

description:
A new job as Junior Business Analyst has just been created in an international company located in the South of Brussels in the FMCG sector. You will be integrating a team of 5 other controllers, and you will be reporting to the Head of Controlling.

As a Junior Business Analyst, you will be responsible of the following tasks:

Contribute to the preparation of the Promotion ROI analysis and improvement proposal to the local team.
Contribute to the preparation of the Customer profitability analysis and overview presentation to local Finance team and to SLT on a session basis.
Participate actively to the construction of the budget and forecast in close collaboration with the local commercial organization with a particular focus on trade agreements.
Support the Financial Reporting, Controlling Manager, and the local team in the Gross to Net analysis and ensure that the sales teams have adequate tools and templates to support the development of the annual plan.
Contribute to the preparation of the Commercial Profit & Loss by Product.
Ideal Profile Of The Junior Business Analyst

Master degree (Business) Economics/Controlling
A first experience of 2 years in a controlling department
FMCG or Retail background is a plus
Advanced skills in Excel and the knowledge of Power Pivot or Power BI is a plus
Fluent in English & French
Good communication skills to collaborate with and challenge key stakeholders
Our Client Is Offering You

A permanent contract
The possibility to work 2 days at home
Continuous trainings
To be part of renowned family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands
A very attractive salary package with interesting advantages in line with your experience
If you have strong organisation and analytical skills, as well as being detail oriented, this job as Junior Business Analyst is what you have been looking for. Do not hesitate to send your CV today with the reference YNN1916912.

description:
There are countless tempting destinations, and we all dream about them. The most desirable destination for all of us is the perfect workplace! Our consultants work commits to finding the working environment you thrive in.

The Role: Conducting a thorough analysis of historical sales data and devising predictive models to evaluate the efficiency of business strategies. Developing and deploying a rigorous KPI framework. Collaborating with the rest of the business unit and being able to communicate cross-functionally to identify new market opportunities as well as ensure a successful rollout of new product offerings.

The Company:Esteemed manufacturer with eco-friendly and environmentally responsible range of products. The main goal is to modernize and streamline operations by moving towards digital solutions, while already being well-known for investing in cutting-edge technologies at their production sites.

The Culture:Atmosphere that is specifically tailored to promote stability and cultivate employee growth. Continues to implement sustainable practices and put their customers needs first. Prioritizes environmental protection and works actively towards minimizing the impact of their products.

The Offer:Remuneration and bonus scheme supplemented by a comprehensive benefits package that includes additional health insurance, food vouchers and sports card.

The Candidate:Experienced in sales, marketing, and finance professional with 3+ years in corporate trading and skilled in analyzing business hypotheses. A degree in Economics, Finance, Business administration or a related field is mandatory. Proficient Business English as well as hands-on experience in project management and process enhancement are necessary. Ability to use Power BI, ERP systems as well as familiarity with analytical engines, other MS Office programs and preferably SQL, will be considered as assets.

If you would like to participate in the company's business growth through data-driven insights, don't hesitate and drop us your CV!

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, our team will contact only those candidates selected for interviews. All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality. Recruitment license from National Agency of Employment 3103.

description:
ALOHAS is more than a fashion brand: it’s a responsible shopping experience and a chance to participate in the fight against overproduction in fashion.

Working at ALOHAS is being part of the innovation and growth of a Spanish start-up with a young, creative and proactive team, good communication and a high level of energy! It’s demanding but extremely rewarding due to an environment where we take pride in learning from one another and strive to make sustainability a way of life beyond the workplace.

In a nutshell,we love what we do and it shows!😀

THE ROLE

We are looking for an Analytics Specialist, highly motivated self-starter who is adaptable, detail-oriented, and proficient at multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment as a data-driven marketer.

You'll be the owner of the technical analytics framework collaborating with Global Digital Director on insights from audiences engaging in other Product tools to inform conversion opportunities and growth, helping ALOHAS to improve and optimize its online marketing activities.

YOUR CHALLENGE

Measure and analyze marketing channel and campaign performance to enhance effectiveness (e.g., Web, SEO, Paid Ads, Affiliates, Email, Social Media, etc.)
Work with the CRO on the design of site experiments, implementing and testing opportunities via Personalization or A/B testing and researching new data sources
Be the owner of the tracking platforms, setup, new implementations, bugs, event creation, etc
Work in Big query to set up queries and extract data
Support the team in implementing additional analytics toolsets
Create a data governance framework and roadmap for analytics, giving guidance where required
Lead the build of cross-channel dashboards through the use of data visualization tools
Support work on integrating digital data with other data sources
Share insights and reports to senior management and other internal stakeholderd
Ensure that analytics data is accurate and there is sufficient monitoring in place to spot issues
Use project management techniques to ensure all changes are delivered on time, to scope and to budget

YOU WILL ROCK AT THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE

Degree in data science, statistics, computer science, business analytics or related field
Hands-on analytical and measurement experience of digital channels such as Web, SEO, E-mail, Affiliates, Paid Ads, Social Media
Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations for stakeholders with varying levels of analytic expertise
Experience with Shopify is an asset
1 year’s experience in an internal/client-facing digital data analysis role
Strong technical abilities and skills specific tool knowledge Google Analytics, Power BI, 365 dynamics, 365 CRM, GTM, Big query and powerapps
Experience with dashboarding and reporting and building end-to-end real-time reporting
Works well cross-functionally to drive tangible business outcomes leveraging analytics

BENEFITS Of Being Part Of ALOHAS

Culture of freedom, diversity & inclusion, and responsibility ✨
Flexible schedule: Fit it into your routine! ⏰
Discounts: You will have special discounts 💯 and we do not forget your family and friends either!
Office: In the heart of Barcelona, in the Gracia neighbourhood, where we take care of coffee ☕ and fruit 🍎
Work remotely: live and work wherever you want 🌍 within the CET time zone!
Home office setup: You will get a laptop + electronic devices like a keyboard, mouse, and second screen 💻
Keep learning with ALOHAS 🎓 We offer English courses to our employees, more languages coming soon!
We take care of your happiness 🌈 and professional growth with constructive feedback 💪
After-work events in Barcelona and Madrid every month 🎉

Ready for the challenge?🚀

About ALOHAS

Want to know more? Video Presentation

Apply to work with us: careers.alohas.io

Our website:alohas.io/ IG: @alohas

description:
Job Summary

As a pivotal member of the team, lead the team from a data / market perspective by pulling external & internal data into intelligence by creating & distributing both standard and ad hoc reports to support the performance of the entire organization. In particular:

Provide reports to the whole Commercial Team to maximize all relevant revenue streams.
Create and maintain interfaces between systems in order to facilitate the monitoring of performance KPIs
Conduct audit of current systems and processes in order to identify digital solutions to reduce manual work, but also guarantee data integrity and accuracy ( ie: monitor and planning of FTE, monitoring of Capex)
Create and maintain consolidated databases for financial, commercial, operational, property management and legal information.
Be the project leader of maintenance and upgrade of the BI tool currently in use in the company ( Phase 1 is live).
Demonstrate a strong business acumen, that questions performance, resilience and innovation are important attributes of this role, along with questioning personality.

Responsibilities

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES – Information analysis & problem solving

Understand Market trends, investigate and extract data from any relevant system needed for problem solving raised by the different teams.
Maintain and distribute standard reports within deadlines (daily, weekly, monthly, yearly and create ad hoc reports)
Create and develop reports to support the Commercial team performance
Provide insight and recommendations to support the different departments in their further analysis
Close and proactive communication with commercial team to coordinate data analysis required to ensure the quality of decision making and results
Maintain and develop excellent relationships with stakeholder, customers, colleagues and peers alike.
Qualifications, Experience & Expectations

Deep Excel skill and knowledge is a must
Power query / any other data transformation / data preparation engine knowledge or data analysis tool is a benefit
Knowledge about hospitality KPI is preferred
Encourages open sharing of best practices within the team
Works to deadlines and performs all duties in a timely and effective manner
Maintains proper flow of information and data within the team and to the hotels, as required
Attends meetings and training required by the line manager
Assists colleagues to perform similar or related jobs when necessary
Continuously seeks to improve the department’s efficient operation, and knowledge of own job function
Complies to company policies to achieve the objectives of the position.
Like what you see……. then get on and apply and don’t miss out!

Hotel Co 51 is a hotel management and development Company. Hotel Co 51 operates hotels in franchise agreement with Marriott International. Our team consists of experienced hoteliers, which support our real estate partner (VASTINT) in operating several Marriott brands currently predominantly a lifestyle brand Moxy and Courtyard by Marriott plus Residence Inn our extended stay product. Our goal is to achieve long-term success to every single project.

MOXY Hotels is Marriott’s newest brand, which opened the first hotel in Milan, Italy, September 2014. MOXY HOTELS are designed to capture the rapidly emerging next-generation traveler. The brand combines contemporary, stylish design, approachable service, latest technology and, most importantly, an affordable price. It’s the new way of travelling!

COURTYARD BY MARRIOTT is the hotel brand of choice for ambitious and enterprising guests who see business travel as a driver of personal fulfillment and professional growth. Courtyard provides opportunities for guests to pursue both their personal and professional passions on the road. With more than 1,200 locations in over 53 countries and territories

RESIDENCE INN BY MARRIOTT is the global leader in the extended-stay lodging segment, with more than 700 properties located in more than 10 countries and territories. Designed for long stays, the brand offers spacious suites with separate living, working, and sleeping zones. Fully functional kitchens; grocery delivery service; 24-hour markets and complimentary breakfasts help guests maximize their time and thrive while they travel.

Marriott International, Inc. is a global leading lodging company with more than 4,200 properties in 79 countries and territories. Marriott International reported revenues of nearly $14 billion in fiscal year 2014. Founded by J. Willard and Alice Marriott and guided by Marriott family leadership for nearly 90 years, the company is headquartered in Bethesda, Maryland, USA.

description:
Are you a big data expert? We are looking for a creative developer to strengthen our geospatial intelligence team

Scania is a world leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. Sustainability at Scania is also about having a healthy work place with diversity, inclusion and equal opportunities for men and women.

Our team, Connected Intelligence, is a group within Connected Systems at Scania R&D. In the context of connectivity, we innovate and deliver scalable analytics that enables informed decision-making for product, service, and business developers.

Do you want to shape our solutions in close cooperation with the stakeholders and the development teams? We provide an environment where we apply agile working methods and where the teams are responsible for their solutions all the way from requirement handling, development, quality assurance to production, and root cause analysis.

Together with us, you get a key role in shaping tomorrow's connected transport system. Our motivation comes from working for a bigger picture where collaboration, innovation, and exploration are common drivers among your colleagues.

Your Assignment

We want to strengthen the geospatial intelligence team to further develop our visualisation and infrastructure for self-service solutions that democratize data from Scania’s connected fleet of more than 500.000 vehicles. The data is derived from GPS-positions, operational vehicle data and other data sources that describe and help improve the global transport network.

You will be working in a cross-functional team to deliver repeatable and quality-assured results through self-sustained analytics services. The competencies in each team usually cover a wide range of areas, such as software development, data engineering, data science and front-end interaction and visualization of data.

The daily work is planned and carried out following agile principles, where your team is part of the department’s flow. You will contribute with your core competence and be responsible for tasks assigned to you during each sprint while over longer periods contributing to the overall planning and vision of the team.

Your profile

You have an academic degree in a computer science related field or equivalent work experience.

As an experienced developer or data scientist, you are analytical, with a genuine technical interest. You enjoy collaboration with different competencies to find the best solution to a problem.

In Addition

You understand how to turn requirements into code to continuously deliver value as you go along.
You have a high-quality focus and an understanding of how industrialized solutions scale -what we build is what we will run in production. Continuous improvement of the development process is a natural priority for you.
You have experience in one or more of the following areas: working with data streaming, big data analytics, cloud software development, geospatial visualisations and/or operational vehicle or transport data.

You communicate fluently in English in both speech and writing.

Our offer

We offer a healthy and inspiring workplace, with focus on respect for the individual, where you have many opportunities to shape your work and your future. Your personal and professional development is important and something we encourage and support.

In addition to personal and professional development opportunities, we offer benefits such as company car, mutual bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje, Scania Job Express. You can also work from our office in central Stockholm from time to time, Scania Sergel.

Contact information

If you have questions about the job you are welcome to contact Frank Deubzer, recruiting manager, at frank.deubzer@scania com

Application

If you feel you have the skills and desire to take on this interesting role, don´t hesitate to apply! Submit your CV and relevant certificates. You don't have to send a cover letter, just upload your CV twice.

Screening and interviews will be done continuously. A background check might be conducted for this position.

We are looking forward to your application!

Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2020, we delivered 66,900 trucks, 5,200 buses as well as 11,000 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 125 billion, of which over 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 50,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com.

description:
At the moment we are looking for a dedicated Data Expert. You will be working in a team of passionate Data Experts focused on sustainable and impact investments. You'll gather, clean, and analyse data from multiple sources, collaborate on innovative projects, and create insightful reports and dashboards.

Project Details

Location: Rotterdam
Type: Hybrid
Duration: 12 months

Responsibilities

Gather and clean data from multiple sources, including data providers, clients, and custodians.
Link financial and sustainability data to ACTIAM investments and analyse the results using software tools and Microsoft BI (SSMS and SSAS).
Develop visually appealing dashboards (Power BI) to enhance ESG integration and disclosure of results.
Explore new methods and data for measuring positive impact and adaptiveness towards sustainability transitions, in collaboration with topic experts.

Requirements

Master's degree in Econometrics, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Economics, Earth Sciences, or a related quantitative field.
5+ years of relevant work experience.
Proven experience with SQL and Power BI.
Knowledge of ESG and financial services is a plus.
Proficiency in Dutch and English, both written and spoken.

If you are interested in this role, please share your latest resume with Tristan Lamme. If you know someone who might be interested in this role, please share his or her details.

Michael Bailey International is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

description:
Beschik jij over de juiste kwaliteiten en denk je een goede toevoeging te zijn voor Trilations? Solliciteer dan voor de functie als Data Analyst. Dan krijg je binnenkort bericht van ons!

De vacature

Het initiële traject ziet er als volgt uit: De eerste weken leer je de Qlik tools kennen, door zowel interne als externe trainingen te volgen. Je wordt ingeschakeld bij bestaande klanten om support en change request taken uit te voeren, eerst ondersteund door een senior consultant, maar snel zelfstandig. Je doet je eerste projecten onder begeleiding van een senior consultant.

Hier gaan we vanuit

Je hebt een goeie feeling voor BI-oplossingen en een sterke interesse in data, analyses, business intelligence en reporting. Een eerste ervaring in het ontwikkelen van BI-oplossingen in Qlik of een andere BI-tool (Power BI, SAP Analytics Cloud, Tableau) levert je een voorsprong op. Je bent enthousiast, toont zin voor initiatief en je staat open voor nieuwe ervaringen. Je bent gedreven in het zoeken naar technische oplossingen voor business vragen en hoe je die kan realiseren met de voorhanden zijnde BI tools. Je hebt ambitie om je carrière in handen te nemen en op korte termijn veel bij te leren. Aanbod Een bedrijf met uitdagende projecten en stevige groeiperspectieven

Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Het salaris is 2100 tot 2500 euro bruto per maand
Je krijgt 32 vakantiedagen
Je werktijden worden flexibel
Voor deze functie is het mogelijk om thuis te werken
Er zullen trainingen worden gegeven
Er is een budget voor werknemers om zich verder op te leiden
Er wordt pensioen opgebouwd
Er is een onkostenvergoeding van kracht
Als medewerker kun je via de werkgever een zorgverzekering afsluiten
Werktelefoon
Werklaptop
lease-auto van het bedrijf
Tankkaart
Je krijgt als werknemer een 13e maand
Mogelijkheid om bonus te verkrijgen

Over Trilations:

Trilations is een open-minded, no-nonsense consultancy organisatie. Wij geloven sterk in langdurig engagement, met zowel onze klanten als onze medewerkers. Wij investeren in het delen van kennis, levenslang leren en coaching en bouwen voort op onze pragmatische cultuur, die is gebaseerd op vertrouwen, professionaliteit, integriteit en betrokkenheid. De consultants van Trilations onderscheiden zich door hun expertise en hun professionele en klantgerichte, vriendelijke houding.

description:
Data Analyst (w/m/d) gesucht- Für unseren Kunden, ein Unternehmen mit Sitz in Dortmund, suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Data Analyst (w/m/d).

Bei der Position handelt es sich um eine direkte Festanstellung bei unserem Kunden. Die Betreuung und Vermittlung sowie alle unsere weiteren Serviceleistungen sind für Dich als Bewerber kostenfrei.

Unser Kunde bietet

Sehr gute Sozialleistungen wie bspw. Arbeitgeberfinanzierte betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Flexible Arbeitsgestaltung durch Nutzung der bestehenden Regelungen zum mobilen Arbeiten (mind. zwei Tage / Woche Präsenz an einem der Standorte)
Anstellung in einem sicheren Arbeitsumfeld bei einem Top Arbeitgeber
Offene Feedbackkultur, flache Hierarchien und ein motiviertes Team
Ausgezeichnete Gestaltungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte bspw. auf Urlaubsreisen, Autos etc.

Deine Aufgaben als Data Analyst (w/m/d)

Du hilfst die Geschäftsprozesse zu optimieren. Dabei arbeitest du an der Schnittstelle zwischen Prozessen und IT und begleitest den Account der datenbasierten Aufnahme der Prozesse bis hin zur Prozessanalyse und Ableitung konkreter Optimierungs- und Automatisierungsmaßnahmen
Du lebst und erlebst technische Vielfalt - Du setzt Projekte und kleinere Initiativen mit Hilfe von digitalen Lösungen und Datenmodelle um und visualisierst aussagekräftige Analysen in Process Mining Tools
Du prüfst bestehende digitale Lösungen und Prozesse und führst Optimierungsmaßnahmen durch
Du berätst das Management sowie die Kolleg:innen aus der Abteilung zu prozessualen und technischen Fragestellungen
Du stellst den optimalen Wissenstransfer innerhalb der Abteilung sicher

Dein Profil

Dein Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, des (Wirtschafs-) Ingenieurwesens, der Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung ist abgeschlossen oder schließt dieses in Kürze ab
Du bringst Interesse an Process Mining, Data Mining und Datenanalyse-Technologien mit
Idealerweise verfügst du über Anwendungskenntnisse in einer der gängigen Sprachen, z.B. Python, PQL oder R. Außerdem kennst du dich mit gängigen Datenbanktechnologien wie bspw. SQL aus
Erfahrung in der Automatisierung mit Tools wie Power Automate und VBA ist von Vorteil
Dynamik, Motivation und Neugier für Accounting-Prozesse
Hervorragende schriftliche und mündliche Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Englisch und Deutsch; Fähigkeit, Personen aus anderen Bereichen komplexe zu erläutern

Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann bewirb dich online als Data Analyst (w/m/d) unter Angabe der Referenznummer 06601-0012598321- Dein Lebenslauf genügt. Bei Fragen steht Dir Gorof Kapoor von Robert Half gerne zur Verfügung.

Die Robert Half Deutschland GmbH & Co. KG verarbeitet die Daten von Bewerbern, die zur Durchführung des Bewerbungsverfahrens erforderlich sind. Weitere Informationen zum Datenschutz, insbesondere zu Ihren Rechten, finden Sie unter

description:
Notre client est un acteur majeur de la grande distribution à dimension internationale. C’est un acteur majeur de la grande distribution qui vit actuellement une transformation d’envergure en adaptant son modèle et son organisation pour devenir le leader de l’e-commerce alimentaire. Il souhaite placer le digital et la data au cœur de toutes ses opérations et de son modèle de création de valeur

Pour accompagner sa croissance d'activité, la direction E-Commerce et Transformation Digitale de notre client cherche un Data Analyst S&OP F/H.

Le Data analyst S&OP est en charge de fournir les données nécessaires à l'animation d'un processus mensuel de l'évolution de l'équation commerciale de la Marque Distributeur du groupe, et d'accompagner, notamment sous forme de reportings, la mise en place des plans d'actions qui en découleront. Il devra définir et déployer l’ensemble des outils analytiques du Département permettant de piloter les marques, les catégories et les différents leviers du mix marketing (assortiment, promotion…).

Vos Missions Consisteront à

Comprendre les enjeux business, identifier les besoins des différentes équipes des Marques du groupe en spécifications analytiques,
Définir et designer les outils de reportings / dashboards correspondants et garantir la fiabilité et la pertinence des outils réalisés,
Mise en place de process/requêtes et automatisation,
Accompagner les équipes dans l’utilisation des reportings pour assurer un fort niveau d’adoption des solutions mises en place,
Favoriser la montée en compétences des équipes en termes de data analytics, et développer leur autonomie en termes d’accès à la donnée, de réalisation d’analyses, de construction de dashboards…
Être force de proposition pour améliorer les solutions développées, et identifier des opportunités de nouveaux outils analytiques pour répondre aux besoins des équipes.

Votre Profil

Issu d'une école d’ingénieur, spécialisé en supply/achat, ou d’une formation universitaire, vous justifiez d'une première expérience sur une fonction similaire dans les métiers de l’analytique en conseil en stratégie, B2C ou chez un panéliste.

Vous Maitrisez Un Ou Plusieurs Des Domaines Suivants

Bonne capacité dans la manipulation de grandes volumétries de données ; maîtrise d’un langage de requêtage des données (SQL, Big Query), d’outils de datavisualisation (Tableau,Google Data Looker Studio) ; la maîtrise de Python / R est un plus,
Expert dans la représentation graphique des analyses et données, et très sensible à la forme et à l’ergonomie,
Maîtrise des panels distributeurs/consommateurs, et des outils d’analyse de performances,
Bon relationnel, créatif, enthousiaste autour de l’analytics et de la data, et forte capacité de vulgarisation et de pédagogie,
Grandes capacités analytiques et statistiques,
Rigueur, proactivité et autonomie,
Connaissance du monde de la grande distribution et/ou industriel souhaité, notamment dans le secteur alimentaire,
Connaissance des process S&OP serait un plus,
Anglais requis, Espagnol souhaité.

Poste à pourvoir en CDI.

description:
Description de l'entreprise

Leader mondial des services d’ingénierie et de R&D, Capgemini Engineering met en œuvre une connaissance sectorielle approfondie et la maîtrise des dernières technologies digitales et logicielles pour accompagner la convergence des mondes physique et numérique. Conjuguée à l’ensemble des capacités du Groupe, Capgemini Engineering aide ses clients à accélérer leur transformation vers l'Intelligent Industry. Capgemini Engineering compte plus de 55 000 ingénieurs et scientifiques dans plus de 30 pays, et opère dans des secteurs tels que : Aéronautique, Spatial, Défense, Naval, Automobile, Ferroviaire, Infrastructure & Transports, Energie, Utilities & Chimie, Sciences de la Vie, Communications, Semiconducteurs & Electronique, Industrie & Biens de consommation, Logiciel & Internet.

Capgemini Engineering fait partie du groupe Capgemini, un leader mondial, responsable et multiculturel, regroupant 325 000 personnes dans plus de 50 pays. Partenaire stratégique des entreprises pour la transformation de leurs activités en tirant profit de toute la puissance de la technologie, le Groupe est guidé au quotidien par sa raison d’être : libérer les énergies humaines par la technologie pour un avenir inclusif et durable. Fort de 55 ans d’expérience et d’une grande expertise des différents secteurs d’activité, Capgemini est reconnu par ses clients pour répondre à l’ensemble de leurs besoins, de la stratégie et du design jusqu’au management des opérations, en tirant parti des innovations dans les domaines en perpétuelle évolution du cloud, de la data, de l’Intelligence Artificielle, de la connectivité, des logiciels, de l’ingénierie digitale et des plateformes. Le Groupe a réalisé un chiffre d'affaires de 18 milliards d'euros en 2021.

Get the Future You Want* - www.capgemini.com.

Capgemini, le futur que vous voulez

Description de la mission

Plus Précisément, Vos Missions Sont Les Suivantes

Vous êtes passionné.e par le domaine de la DATA et vous souhaitez prendre part à un projet d’envergure dans le secteur des telecom . Rejoignez notre équipe Hybrid Intelligence au sein de Capgemini Engineering en tant que DATA Analyst.

Comprendre le besoin métier, évaluer les charges et concevoir les solutions techniques et fonctionnelles
Rédiger le cahier des charges et décrire sous forme de spécifications
Assurer le lien entre le besoin métier et les possibilités fonctionnelles et informatiques
Fournir aux équipes techniques les documents projets
Ecrire les cahiers de recette applicative
Assurer la coordination et le suivi de la recette fonctionnelle avec les experts métiers
Former et assurer le support aux experts métiers

Profil

Vous êtes issu.e d’une formation ingénieur ou équivalent bac+5 informatique spécialisé en business intelligence et vous justifiez d’une expérience réussie dans le développement/ intégration de solutions BI (Minimum 2 ans).

Vous maîtrisez Power BI et le langage SQL. La connaissance d’un ETL est un réel plus.

Enfin, vous avez le sens des priorités, vous êtes reconnu.e pour votre capacité à créer du lien avec les équipes techniques et les équipes métiers.

Vous vous reconnaissez dans la description du profil et vous souhaitez en savoir plus ? Postulez dès maintenant !

description:
Im Rahmen geldpolitischer Operationen des Eurosystems können Geschäftsbanken Kreditforderungen als Sicherheiten für die Refinanzierung bei der Deutschen Bundesbank einsetzen. Bedingung dafür ist, dass die als Schuldner auftretenden Unternehmen den hohen Bonitätsanforderungen des Eurosystems genügen, deren Erreichen die Bundesbank anhand von Bilanz- und Geschäftsmodellanalysen überprüft.

Arbeit von besonderem Wert: Ihr Einsatz bei uns

Als Mitarbeiter*in im Referat Bonitätsanalyse und Wertpapiere werten Sie Jahresabschlüsse von Unternehmen des nichtfinanziellen Sektors aus.
Sie analysieren die Ergebnisse auf der Grundlage unserer internen Bonitätsbeurteilungsverfahren.
Auf Basis Ihrer Analyse schlagen Sie die Bonitätseinstufung der Unternehmen vor.
Dabei bereiten Sie die Gespräche mit Unternehmensvertretungen vor und nehmen an diesen Gesprächen teil.

Besondere Werte: Ihre Qualifikationen

Akkreditierter Bachelor- oder gleichwertiger Studienabschluss der Wirtschaftswissenschaften.
Alternativ: Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung mit langjähriger einschlägiger beruflichen Erfahrung im Bereich der Finanzierung oder Bankwesen.
Umfassende betriebswirtschaftliche Kenntnisse, insbesondere in den Gebieten Bilanzierung, Finanzierung und Gesellschaftsrecht.
Gute Kenntnisse der Finanzmathematik und Statistik.
Kenntnisse bezüglich Bonitätsanalyse/Ratingverfahren von Vorteil.
Grundlegende Kenntnisse zum geldpolitischen Instrumentarium des ESZB.
Kenntnisse der Konzernrechnungslegung und der IFRS wünschenswert.
Überdurchschnittliches Engagement, analytisches Denk- und sicheres Urteilsvermögen.
Ausgeprägte Eigenständigkeit, sicheres Auftreten, Belastbarkeit und Flexibilität.
Teamfähigkeit.
Sehr gutes mündliches und schriftliches Ausdrucksvermögen in deutscher Sprache.

Wertvolle Arbeit verdient besondere Vorteile

Vergütung & Perspektiven

Vergütung in Anlehnung an den TVöD auf Basis der Entgeltgruppe E 9b zzgl. Bankzulage mit Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis, grundsätzliche Verbeamtungsmöglichkeit

New Work

Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten, Arbeitszeit: 39 Stunden/Woche, 30 Tage Urlaub, flexible und planbare Arbeitszeiten, Förderung der Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie/Work-Life-Balance

Zusatzleistungen

betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement , Betriebsrestaurant, kostenloses Jobticket, gute Verkehrsanbindung (Bus & Bahn), kostenloses Konto und Depot, Teilzeitbeschäftigung ist grundsätzlich möglich

Wollen Sie unser Team bereichern?

job_posting_title: Junior Market Data Analyst - sector Fashion
description:
Country

Bulgaria

Job Family

Operations

For almost 90 years, GfK has been a reliable and trusted insight partner for the world’s biggest companies and leading brands who make a difference in every consumer’s life - and we will continue to build on this. We connect data, science and innovative digital research solutions to provide answers for key business questions around consumers, markets, ROI, brands and media. With our headquarters in Germany and a presence in around 60 countries worldwide, you benefit from our global company with a diverse community of 8,000+ employees.

Harnessing the power of our workforce, the greatest asset we have is our people. As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and will support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future, as we continue our evolution from Market Research provider to SaaS data solutions and consulting partner. We value extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. For our employees as well as for our clients we pursue one goal: Growth from Knowledge!

Job Description

Junior Market Data Analyst - sector Fashion

Mission Of The Role

The purpose of the role is to ensure the quantitative and qualitative control of marketing data and the creation of new products in existing databases, complying with all global quality requirements.

You Will

Search for information on the Internet about the characteristics of different products for the sector Fashion.
Enter the received information in a database or Excel.
Categorize, classify and update of information in Excel.
Ensure quality data control.
Manage the monthly production of data through internal platforms.
Ensure the publication of data according to customer requirements and deadlines.
Track several market trends.
Work with specialized applications for database processing.
Cooperation with other internal departments and partners of GfK.
Report to Service Manager GSC MI.
You Have

University degree in: Economics, Mathematics, Information Technology, Data Management or other related area
Working level in English (B1 - B2)
Good knowledge of MS Office (Excel)
In-depth knowledge of methods, procedures and tools for data processing and analysis
Initiative and analytical thinking
Attention to detail
Maintaining high- quality standards
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Skills to work within deadlines and goals
Benefits

Use the latest digital technologies.
Ongoing trainings to support your development.
Opportunities for personal and professional growth.
Competitive remuneration and bonus scheme linked to individual performance and company results.
Flexible working hours and home office.
3 additional non-working days annually.
Food vouchers
Health insurance
Discount program with external vendors
Multisport card
Eco friendly travelers are welcome to the office – parking places for bikers and free card for public transportation are available to all employees
Last but not least – GfK Sofia office is located close to the city centre and easily accessible from any point by public transportation – 47A Tsarisgradsko Shose Blvd
All documents will be treated in the strictest confidentiality.

Only short-listed candidates will be invited for an interview.

Сътрудник маркетингови данни - сектор Мода

Цел на позицията:

Целта на позицията е осигуряване на количествения и качествен контрол на маркетинговите данни, непосредствено преди публикуването им и създаване на нови продукти в съществуващи бази данни, спазвайки всички глобални изисквания за качество.

Като Сътрудник Маркетингови Данни, Ще Имате Следните Ключови Отговорности

Търсене на информация в интернет за характеристики на различни продукти
Въвеждане на получената информация в база данни или Excel
Категоризиране, класифициране и актуализиране на информацията в Excel
Подсигуряване качествения контрол на данните
Отговаряне за месечната продукция на данните посредством вътрешни платформи
Осигуряване публикуването на данните според изискванията на клиентите и предварително установени крайни срокове
Ефективно управление на възникнали проблеми и казуси
Проследяване на различни пазарни тенденции
Работа със специализирани приложения за обработка на база данни
Сътрудничество с други вътрешни отдели и партньори на GfK
Какви умения, опит и квалификация са ви необходими, след като вече знаете какво прави Сътрудник маркетингови данни?

Висше образование в сферата на: Икономика, Математика, Информационни технологии, Управление на данни или друго свързано с естеството на работа
Работно ниво на английски език (B1 – B2)
Много добри умения за работа с MS Office (Excel)
Задълбочени познания за методи, процедури и инструменти за обработка на данни и изготвяне на анализи
Комбинативност, инициативност и аналитично мислене
Внимание към детайлите поддържане на високи стандарти на качество
Отлични комуникативни умения
Умения за работа в екип
Умения за работа с крайни срокове и поставени цели
Присъединете се към нашия екип и се възползвайте от следните придобивки:

Опит в глобална организация, лидер в своята област
Първоначално и последващо обучение
Възможности за професионално и личностно развитие
Работа в амбициозен и мотивиран екип
Конкурентно възнаграждение и бонус програма, обвързана с личното представяне и резултатите на компанията
Сумирано изчисляване на работното време и възможност за работа от вкъщи
Три допълнителни неработни дни годишно
Ваучери за храна
Здравно застраховане
Програма за отстъпки с външни партньори
Мултиспорт карта
Достъп до едни от най-модерните технологии
Безплатна карта за градския транспорт за всички линии и паркоместа за велосипеди
Последно, но не и по важност – отлична локация на офиса в близост до центъра на София с удобен градски транспорт – бул. Цариградско шосе 47А
Високо оценяваме интереса към компанията и благодарим на всички кандидати за отделеното време.

job_posting_title: Analista de datos en entornos de fabricación
description:
Sobre el Grupo CAF

La movilidad sostenible es uno de los retos más importantes de la sociedad actual. Es necesario contar con redes de transporte de gran capacidad que ofrezcan un alto nivel de confort a los pasajeros y que al mismo tiempo sean respetuosas con el medio ambiente.

El Grupo CAF es uno de los líderes internacionales en el diseño e implantación de sistemas integrales de movilidad sostenible. Además, cuenta con una amplia gama de productos y servicios que incluyen el diseño del sistema, obra civil, señalización, otros sistemas electromecánicos, servicios, suministro de material rodante y operación del sistema.

Funciones y Responsabilidades

Se requiere persona que se responsabilice de la obtención de indicadores de producción, costes, plazos, etc. siendo el responsable de generarl el sistema de base de datos para analizar la productividad y la eficiencia y por tanto mejorar la eficiencia operativa.

El negocio de vehículos se encuentra inmerso en un proceso de transformación de su modelo operativo. Esta transformación busca la mejora a través de la especialización y la estandarización tanto de los productos como de los procesos. En este contexto surge la necesidad de implantar una gestión de proyectos basada en tareas estándar con el objetivo de medir, analizar y mejorar la eficiencia.

En el marco de la transformación del negocio de vehículos, se integrará en el equipo de ingeniería de producción, responsabilizándose de generar el sistema para automatizar la extracción de datos para su posterior análisis y toma de decisiones.

Formación requerida

Formación universitaria en Ingeniería (Ingeniero Superior/ Máster) o Licenciatura técnica

Experiencia profesional requerida

Analista de datos en entornos de fabricación, aportar experiencia de al menos 3 años en puestos similares.

Competencias

Atender a los clientes

Esforzarse para lograr resultados

Demostración de experiencia técnica

Pensamiento crítico

Adaptarse a los cambios

Comportarse con integridad

Creación y mantenimiento de equipos

Otros Requisitos

Buscamos una persona con conocimientos en Business Analytics/Intelligence capaz de establecer herramientas y modelos de datos que permitan tomar decisiones e impulsar la mejora continua en los procesos de Fabricación.

Persona pro-activa, ejecutiva, con capacidad analítica y orientada a objetivos. Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y liderazgo.
Conocimientos de bases de datos y herramientas de Business Analytics y Business Intelligence. Experiencia en implantación de procesos de gestión basados en Business Analytics y Business Intelligence.
Se valorará que haya colaborado en procesos de transformación y mejora de Fabricación.
